9lbRaIkAQftC7ujgIwa72A.text: Nothing special. Loud atmosphere, staff lacks experience in proper service. If your desperate to eat and are ok with average food, poor atmosphere and a staff that lacks experience then your good to go.

gTkmSOCFW5Y-8oA8awGQKw.text: I love Asian Food.       That being said Fusion places can be very satisfying due to a range of unique choices. But those choices have to be good.      After shopping at Whole Foods we decided to dine here since it appeared to have a good crowd.      The menu has a wide variety of dishes and is very appealing.      We thought of soup and asked a couple next to us what they had and if they liked it. Their reply was that every soup here is great and theirs was the Hot and Sour soup. They were nice enough to lets us try a spoonful after saving their extra. You get a large bowl for a good price.       To be honest it was the best part of our meal along with the sliced BBQ pork. We didn't get any other soup since my friend wanted shrimp.      We started with the Crab Puffs and BBQ Sliced Pork. The puffs were OK though soggy in the center since they weren't fried long enough. The pork was delicious, tender and moist. And was in a nice sauce.      I ordered the Chicken Vindaloo (The worst I've ever had.) Fair taste but no spice with what looked like pre cooked chicken.      My friend had the Spicy Cinnamon Shrimp. A big waste of money. 5 shrimp in a Cinnamon sauce that had very little spice or heat and the 1 I tried, I would swear was cooked with it shell on. Either that or it had the toughest skin under the shell I've ever eaten. They were cooked with peas and came on this big bed of fried wonton strips. It was not worth the money.       If we do return it will be for the soup and to try the Sweet and Sour Chicken which looked good on the table next to us.

jC0oSkaoq9QmjfApSb-JKg.text: Flo's is a very good restaurant.  The food is yummy and service was outstanding.  The bus person asked us many times if everything was alright and kept our water glasses full.  I asked for chicken with vegetables (not on the menu) and asked for more veggies and less chicken.  They made my dish perfect with lots of nice tender crisp veggies.  Nice place to catch a game as they have 3 tv screens over the bar.  Much healthier than bar food.  Happy hour lasts until 7:00 every evening with half price drinks and appetizers.

fMWmOjxNymP4JZVv3C0WtA.text: I love Flo's! I'm so happy this restaurant has finally made its way to Tempe... So delicious.  And a really really..... REALLY good happy hour menu.  Half off all drinks and great appetizer specials.  The food is just as amazing as the other locations.  My favorite is the Mongolian Beef, but the bartender introduced me to the salt and pepper wings which might be my new obsession.  This place is brand new so expect some slight hiccups, but he final product is always is delicious!!!   I  heart Flo's!!!

7i5GGuzmNDAHA4B4bafajA.text: Amazing service. Haply hour is excellent! The long islands.. NICE!! Everything i have had on the menu has been great. Really enjoy the staff.

pSywo9Imd3MCaCx24Y_VTQ.text: We were pleasantly surprised with the quality, quantity, and cleanliness of Flos. The menu offers spicy Thai, spicy Chinese, mild dishes as well as gluten free items. They have fleshly brewed China mist black tea which is mild and delicious. Happy Hour is 3-7pm every day. Saturday lunch special is $6. I had the pad Thai which spicy but not "hot spicy". They have a full bar and deserts. Casual dinning and comfortable seating, no booths. Friendly service from the hostess to our server. I will be back and highly recommend Flos to everyone. Try them out you'll be glad you did!

dbnVX4Is4VRk2sT6KWv3Vw.text: Great food, nice environment, service mediocre. Can't believe this used to be McDonald's!!

T5IsH71RmWVaoBoBTGKFcg.text: Pricey and Bland.  We ordered takeout for the whole family.  Spicy Orange chicken sauce was ok but even with the sauce the deep fried chicken had an ultra bland taste. Black Pepper chicken was a little better, but overloaded with huge onion chunks and bell peppers about 8-1 ratio Onion and bell pepper to chicken.  Crispy spring rolls were also a dud.  The place was packed, but it was 7pm on a Friday night and it's new to the area.  My wife said the tofu was descent.  Long story short I'd go to Pei Wei or PF Chang's 10 out of 10 times over this place.

dHFOH26c9ZzwZ3P1N2q39Q.text: We arrived shortly after 3:30, got sat on a tiny table and were ignored for almost 20 minutes. Plenty of staff running around, it must have been shift change as nobody wanted to serve us. The noise level was terrible, like sitting in an echo chamber. We left and had a great meal at Tokyo Joes across the street.

6HRrl2FTk7R3f7VD47luig.text: All the food was full of flavor & extremely satisfying!  The best Hot & Sour Soup I have tasted. The staff was polite & helpful. They brought the wrong meal for my son & initially they forgot to bring our soup, but everything was quickly corrected.  Will definitely visit again.

nr-EkFSecnKB-mVLDPBN_Q.text: My fiancee and I came here as a celebration, got chocolate wantons as a gift. Amazing atmosphere! Beautiful menus and easy  to read. The staff so so friendly! Stephanie was amazing and very personable. We will be here again soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Flo's - New Asian Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States. Mandarin oriental martinis

d1BZhSUw7aI6V2-PoB2m7A.text: This is the newest in the chain of restaurants owned by Flo. This is my preliminary review, as the restaurant has only been open for two days and like all new places it has a few things to work out.  I arrived at 6:30 and was seated immediately. I was offered a libation and ordered a Diet Coke, the only diet drink on the menu. I would have ordered Iced Tea except that the only sweetener available was what many restaurants have removed from their tables in favor of Splenda. Unfortunately, the carbonator on the soft drink line was not working properly and my Diet Coke was mostly syrup and water.  The restaurant was nice looking, but was all hard surfaces making for a somewhat noisy environment. The addition of some soft hangings or some carpet would ameliorate the amount of sound.  First ordered were Spicy Wontons and Chinese Lettuce Cups. The wontons had good texture and I loved the very light wrapper around it. The flavor was very light as was the spice but I would order it again. Unfortunately, I cannot say the same for the lettuce wraps. My plate contained a half head of lettuce which was not taken apart at all, so my first order of things to do was to tear apart a half head of lettuce. In doing this a number of the leaves broke apart, leaving me with broken leaves to place the contents on and later drip down my hands. The filling did not impress me as it seemed to lack flavor which the accompanying sauces could not make up for.  Next was the Hot and Sour soup. A lovely bowl of properly gelatinous soup swimming with all sorts of goodies including very fresh shrimp. I added some vinegar and chili oil and it tasted just like I remember from China. This soup was dynamite! I'd have loved a bit of Ogo in it but it was a great soup.  Next was Kung Pao Chicken. One of the ingredients in it was zucchini which was a nice surprise since so many places use celery. A second nice surprise happened when I was served both white and brown rice. While white rice is traditional in oriental cookery, the brown rice is a nice addition for those who prefer a healthier option or prefer the nutty taste of it. The chicken was cooked to perfection, but once again the dish seemed to lack in the flavor department. It seemed to be lacking the heat and flavor that should be part of the dish, as well as the peanuts that I could not find.  I was brought Ma Po Tofu to try. It was made with regular peppers, and while the ingredients were all there, none of the heat was. I wish it had been made with real Szechuan peppercorns which would have made it an authentic dish even if it had to cost more.  Last was the Chocolate Wontons. Half wontons cooked till hardened then covered in a dark chocolate sauce plated with a slice of orange and dusted with powdered sugar. I appreciated the interplay of the orange and chocolate, but there was no way to eat it without getting my fingers dipped in chocolate too. Not that that is necessarily bad for a chocolate lover, but getting cleaned up afterward without a wet nap is a problem.  Overall, as a new opening there are a few problems to be ironed out, especially in the flavor area. Most of the food seemed cooked beautifully but lacking all sorts of seasoning. While Flo is noted for healthy variations in her food, she is not known for lack of flavor and I am hoping that this will be worked out by my next visit in a few months. If I had to sum up the food in one word it would be fresh. The food was anything but tired and worn out and the use of nice fresh ingredients was apparent.  The restaurant seemed spotless. The waitstaff was a little confused but that is to be expected in a new opening. The cashier needs to know that sitting on the counter where the register is does not look nice and is unacceptable.  I'm giving 4 stars for quality of ingredients and for service in a new environment. Next time I hope to give 4 stars for flavor as well.   As my readers know, I do not accept free meals, and after paying for my dinner I found that the  charge on my card had been voided and the meal had been comped. In keeping with my precepts, I have donated the cost of the meal to a local charity.

0URtV-D6pKSsW-4SDaK4sg.text: Wonderful service and an outstanding happy hour menu price list! Husband has picked up takeout for lunch from here a couple of times and said it was good. We stopped by tonight and ordered 4 apps and beers and our bill was incredibly reasonable due to happy hour. We had dumplings, calamari, shrimp skewers and pork slices. They were all yummy! We will definitely return when in the neighborhood. Thanks Flo's!

HTdRZglRg5_u0B3r5dtflQ.text: I recently became Pescatarian, but REALLY love Asian food. It's basically a guilty pleasure. So when we walked in and smelled the amazing Flo's smells, I almost died. Our server, a tall blonde man was great with getting us beers and waters, and made sure to help me find the right dish -- Sweet and Sour Tofu with white rice. and it was DELICIOUS. The atmosphere in the Tempe Flo's is great too. We will definitely be back :)

WpUWTi9TTOid6icfidEVJw.text: Love, Love Love this place for happy hour. 1/2 price drinks and appetizers and the food is great. We always come with a big group and the service is always very good. There's a good size patio to be able to eat outside also. Definitely will be back.

9UyOSM1e8jUsPuJrV_iRaA.text: I was so excited that there is a Flo's in Tempe!  The selection, service, and food are amazing.  I try and go once a week to get dinner or lunch.  This is the best Chinese I've had in the area.  My favorites were Garlic Chicken, Orange Chicken, and Mongolian Beef.  I just wish you could order a cup of soup with dinner, but they are generous with portion sizes and offering to bring more rice free of charge.  On Friday and Saturday nights, I would recommend getting there either before 5:30, or after 8:00 if possible, it gets busy and wait times can be long.

ut43zL4_a_rgOxS4uAws6g.text: After going to Flo's loyally for so long they go and change the prices on their happy hour menu. The main reason for going to this spot was the great deals during Happy hour. Our bill doubled for the exact order and the staff didn't seem to care. I showed my bill for the exact same order a few weeks earlier and the amount was $2 shy of being doubled. On to better places now.

r1xJ2wsw6wrfBM4x0Wu5KQ.text: My boyfriend and I have been here a few times. The first time we were invited for a party get together. We had a great experience and the food was great. So we have been returning to enjoy a great meal. We always get two of the same things on the meal, the crab puffs and the beef lo mien are our favorites! We always choice another different entree to get as well. There menu has a lot to choose from, so we never have a problem finding something that sounds good, more of a problem trying to just pick the one thing. So far everything we have ever ordered has been delicious. The portions are pretty big, we order two entrees to share and always still have leftovers to take home. I highly recommend giving this place a shot if you're looking for a great meal!

fUgM3J9GStlAKAury3XSjQ.text: I love this place! Great flavor in all the dishes I've tried, my all time fave is the Chinese Lettuce Wraps! Lunch is definitely the best time to go, excellent portions and affordable prices. I plan on working my way down the entire lunch menu! Walking in, the lighting is beautiful and natural because of the big windows, it's super open space, high ceilings, cute decor, this place is modern and lovely. All the servers have been genuine and kind also!   Highly recommend for a quick bite, or even a nice family friends dinner :)

2IcIfQwKvr7X9fmL2GHd9A.text: I live in Los Angeles, when i am in Mesa and Tempe, AZ, i have to eat here everynight . Eveyone here are awsome and food is incredible. Jerry the manager and Stephenie the amazing server is why i come everytime when I am in this part of the country. COME HERE ONE TIME and you know if i am right.

UdBb4URZpZFseGb3ZGBcrg.text: This location has been horrible, the other locations have been great. Since this location is near my house, I still for some reason due take out a couple times a year. MY MISTAKE, I ordered tonight and I always inform the CSR to place notes on my order to please make everything fresh as It is not always fresh from the past. Well, I picked my order up and sure as can be the spring rolls and crab puffs were cold, I informed the manager and he said hold on a minutes and took the two items back. He came out and said, "here they are fresh straight from the oil" Well, I got home and I was shocked the store manager would take the original items and toss them back in the oil and not even have the professional solution by making the complete order over, how do I know, both the items were burnt. Very obvious they were reheated in oil. I took pictures, but do not see a place on yelp to upload.  This is not cheap drive-through, and as a store manager he should of made it right, I am ashamed that customer service is coming to this.

Os0Ay5UpM9lj7s7XTOycag.text: The food here tastes good and overall it's a nice place but the prices are high for the quality/qty of food you receive, point in case the fried rice is $13 and whichever protein you add is proportionately small. Kids meals are $7 for a large serving which is great. Happy hour makes drinks and apps. half off which is nice. There are many other Chinese cuisine options that offer better quality food at a more affordable price.  The downside to dining in is that it's loud, mega loud inside but if you're a large group this would be a good place since the service was very attentive.

2heRYdUx7KM29D9LBWGteA.text: While the waiter was attentive, the food was so salty, it was inedible. Huge waste of money. I ate 3 pieces of the edamame after having had to wipe the heavy salt off of each. Had about 4 bites of the Hot & Sour soup - way too salty, as well. Very disappointing. Should have asked for a discount, or should have been offered one, but no.

nR3C05vTtKLPcagmPurkbw.text: Where in the Valley can you find Happy Hour 7 days a week from 3-7? Where?  Tell me! lol .... Well, I'm sure there's other places but I haven't experiences them .. nor have I experiences any Asian Fusin/Chinese food in the Valley as good.  I've been here at least 3 times since Flo's opened.  Thus far I've tried the shrimp lo mein, Teriyaki salmon, Chicken wraps and the Hot and Sour soup.  My goodness ... the Hot and Sour soup is absolutely delicious!  Theeeee best!  There's also a really good Pomerita they make ... it's not your average Pomerita but it's delicious. All the 3 times I've been I've never had to wait for seating, either at the bar or in the dining area.  2 thumbs up for me! Give Flo's a try :)

-eikX6FvYMfFLEf-_Pao8Q.text: Trying to find good Thai in Phoenix can be a challenge. So is trying to find good Chinese that doesn't make you want to fall asleep an hour afterwards. I think Flo's just came up 2 for 1. My GF is gluten free and loves calamari, loves breaded calamari but can't eat it. Bam. In comes Flo's to save the day. They have this seasoning that imitates breading and is actually pretty awesome. I had the spicy pork and added pineapple. Recommendation of the the waitress and bam, home run! It was out of the park good.  The portion size is great for the average person to have two servings. I'll admit it, I ate the whole thing.   So good.

NBV1i8mUlP1JpwQYMc6hrA.text: Met a friend here for happy hour, Great drink and food specials, We had lettuce wraps and dumplings and other goodies, Everything was cheap and good, Spent very little and had lunch the next day! The dirnks were really good, The place is nice, upscale, Has been packed both times we went.

The only negative was the hostess didn't say "bye" or " see you next time" she just watched me walk out. Still enjoy this place though!

2zSk-iiI7mz4oI7-eI5taA.text: Stephanie was our waitress and was extremely attentive introduced myself and my business partner to the lunch menu and guided us both to a delicious and customized items for both of our dietary needs and edible desires. I ate the beef/broccoli sweet and spicy with veggies and no rice. The veggies were cooked perfectly, and not over cooked nor undercooked and the meet was tender. Highly recommended for a nice lunch or dinner. Ask for Stephanie and share with her a story from "Alexa" to make for good conversation and a laugh.

UI0UQHZncYZTYYvTsVWdLg.text: Pretty disappointing. I came with my daughter to enjoy birthday dinner and the farthest we got was being seated by the host and I got to watch the wait staff run around and small talk with customers and run behind the bar and make drinks for about 10 minutes and no one even acknowledged to offer a glass of water.

90Ds2OOqZ_S92lFrGN6b-w.text: Few words worth spitting back up for this place, but the food certainly is. The last thing I would want to do is write an instruction manual for the management with my review and see this place survive as a result. Rude twenty something server, bland food, sad, sad vibe. Fresh spring rolls, "summer rolls" here, look like dog turd with worms. Wierd culture. Staff seemed miserable. Don't eat here if you value your time or money.   [Let's see if this gets removed by yelp like my wife's did]

asCWkrB8nLN6OLG3WlvvDQ.text: I wish I could give this location 5 stars but due to the service I last received when introducing my mother to this place it gets 3.   Previously I had a great experience with a large group of friends one happy hour after work, but fast forward to when I brought my mother here it was a completely different experience.  The food hands down is delish and you can beat 1/2 off any drink and 1/2 appetizers (with exception to a couple that are not included).   The place was actually quite dead when I made my last visit, which struck me odd that our server was so poor at serving us. We actually had about 4-5 different servicers drop by our table since our waiter went M.I.A. on multiple occasions. Come to find out he's outside on his phone and I found him chatting it up with a table that had shown up some time after us. Later I found out there was a co-worker at that table and apparently that gets you priority service.  Anywho - if you're looking for an awesome happy hour with great prices and delicious food check this place out but be prepared it's a hit or miss experience with the service.

oIjQJOa0PAISM6T9yf9cow.text: The egg drop soup comes in a HUGE portion. Like, it was surprising to get that much soup for that price and as an appetizer. It was delightful though! I had the pad thai and loved it! My husband has the Kung Pao and said it was the best he's ever had. Would definitely recommend this place :)

Qe9GheN6jKtkSTBd2RqV6A.text: The girls and I decided to stop by for lunch. I read reviews and determined it was promising. Till This day my girlfriend still gives me crap for picking this place. Food was mediocre, service was slow and my friends dish looked like someone threw it up into her plate. If your looking to try to new places and don't really mind the quality of you're experience I would say try this place.

rjGFwjAaRggsXLox6L_ArQ.text: Flo's has done an amazing job of remodeling an old McDonalds. The former McDonalds' drive-thru is now outdoor seating and the inside has been redone in a "yuppie-wannabe" sleek, modern look. It was 12:30pm on a cold, rainy day and the place was not even half full.   I was seated right away and my server brought me some water and took my order promptly. I requested some hot green tea since it was a cold day. Beverages are not listed on the menu, so I have no idea what this costs. I never did find out since they never brought my tea. My server stopped back as I finished my meal and I told him to cancel the tea since I was done eating.  I ordered the Lemon Chicken ($9 for lunch) with brown rice. This was supposed to be a special recipe of the chef. Unfortunately, there was no detectable lemon flavor--in fact no flavor at all. Surprisingly, this was the most bland Asian food I have ever encountered. It was so bland that I could not even eat half of the food on the plate (and this was a smaller portion size than most Asian restaurants serve). The chicken was odd in that it was in small flat squares--sort of like the frozen meat chunks you encounter at YC's Mongolian Grill.  I was also brought a small salad with some kind of ginger-peanut sauce on it. It was OK, nothing special. It was also a surprise since there is nothing on the menu about salads being included with my meal. The obligatory fortune cookie shows up with the bill.  The restaurant is clean and the staff efficient (except for the hot tea fiasco). Parking has always been difficult in this particular shopping center. I probably would not go out of my way to eat here again.

giXy6NHYSdFJ4jaNivsmYg.text: I really enjoy the menu and all the wonderful options and tastes.   For example, by offering (and mentioning it in the menu) the flexibility to substitute tofu in any dish, it opens up endless possibilities not offered in most other Asian restaurants.    The last few times I have subbed in the rather unhealthy yet tasty fried tofu in the pan fried noodle and beef and broccoli dishes.   As a bonus, they even reduce the price when  replacing meat with tofu.     Here's where Flo's needs improvement.   First, the service has been very very slow the last few times I've been there.  I don't know  what the holdup is as there appears to be plenty of staff present.   Perhaps the staff needs additional training.  Second, the food has come out warm, not hot.   Could be the slow staff leaves food sitting under the warmers getting cold.     Overall a great place and worth checking out if you're in the area.

ZHA65ggLqUPi8VpmjW6EvA.text: While visiting Tempe we tried this place out! It was really good. The Chinese Chinese Chicken Lettuce Wraps were amazing! We had the Pork Potstickers and Shrimp Spring Rolls, the potstickers were good, We wish they were cooked a little longer. The Shrimp Spring Rolls tasted great and everything was fresh! For dinner we shared the Shrimp in Lobster Sauce with Brown Rice and it was delicious! We recieved a complementy order of the chocolate won tons for dessert due to it being our first time there. When we visit Tempe next time we will definatly be back!

5jxKaBt6-uB7WEHRAaIXRw.text: Two words - HAPPY HOUR!!! Actually- more words - SEVEN DAYS A WEEK! Appetizers are almost all half price, drink specials are totally reasonable. The spring rolls are so good. Spicy ginger beef - yummy. Orange chicken w sauce on the side. Mongolian beef - add spicy. I could go on and on. Only thing I didn't Love was the calamari. Bar staff is nice, and happy hour - again- is seven days a week!

pSfnvrNL0SjUrDHRjOXLUg.text: I've giving them 3 stars instead of 4 based on lack of parking. It's absolutely ridiculous. There's no 10 min parking for takeout, be prepared to walk a couple hundred feet. Once your inside it's great. I've been here at least a half dozen times. It's always packed. The food doesn't blow your mind but it's predictably good.   The kong poa & orange chicken are my favorites.

u4mvwkosAXv5XVMt2nAF3Q.text: 1st time here love trying new spots!Foid ,service ,environment was amazing!outr waitress Mary was great very professional and friendly,.. Defs recommend this place !

sKMla4Eawm8S-IPyP_Xlzg.text: Kat, at bar is awesome, try her wing sauce! Flo's management seriously add this to the menu.

v6dUToxY05kLVu6bvXq9nw.text: Walking distance from my house. Great portions. Great HH prices. Full bar. Spacious environment. I dig this place.

OSOt3suXra9L0baKAfvNDA.text: The  food was reasonably priced and they are very accommodating to vegitarian but the four dishes we ordered were a bit bland. The atmosphere is awesome and we are planning to try it again to seen if they had an off night

2gzmENvk3X_8TN8Pt1Oekg.text: We ordered two teriyaki lunch specials & they were great for the price. Plus the staff was friendly & helpful.

YcKpIXg7Fwy-T4b7OMQ_zg.text: I had the Pad Thai it was awful!! They didn't even get the noodles right.. it was garbage.. I paid for a plate I didn't even eat or like. I tried the one in N Scottsdale and the quality of food is so much better. It was dirty here.. our waiter was nice ..

rLNwI7-L587gUsSZuKEH9Q.text: Excellent first impression, and on takeout. She had the Fried Honey Beef and I had the Seafood Sizzling Rice Guo Ba. Normally I don't let my first visit anywhere include a seafood dish, but I sure am glad I did. The food was delicious, prepared entirely on time, and the staff was very friendly when I arrived.  We're looking forward to dining in, and expect the next review to become a 5/5 for us. Nice looking place, in and out!

KuGVNsmhUatUlGKt2fZc0A.text: I had the Thai style catfish and it was so delicious. It has a sauce that resembles curry although it's not exactly like it. The fried rice it's absolutely delicious... I will definitely be coming back for more! Lindsay is excellent! Kevin, the store Manager made sure our meals were timely and our experience a great one! Thanks!!

GvXHYiPzPZ46WAzX2271Ig.text: I want to like this place. In Tempe. Not a chain. Great remodel of McDonald's. Food is average. Service bad. Tonight ate at the bar. Bartender was too busy hanging out with his friends to wait on me. When I was done it took more than 20 minutes to get his attention to get my food picked up and a check.  Even tried waving my credit card at him. Didn't work. And I was sitting less than 3 feet away. Also found it disconcerting that one employee kneeled at the bar while a co-worker gave him an extended shoulder massage. Eeuw.

aUs5hSnzywkhOjT0nuqP5Q.text: Flo's is in one word... AWESOME! My family and I had reservations for 6 PM last night. Although the restaurant was very full we were shown to our table promptly at 6. The hostess waited for us to be seated and handed us our menus. She was very personable and answered all of the questions we had. Our bartender Blaze warmly welcomed us back for he must have remembered our faces. Total thumbs up in my book! Chris was also very attentive and the food was DELICIOUS! Blaze very patiently took care us and made the whole family out-ing great. Blaze, Chris, and all of Flo's staff... YOU ROCK! So glad Flo's has opened in our neighborhood.

hloeRaRL4X8VULhGTNWbKw.text: While I don't know if everything here is worthy of 5 stars, the Cashew Chicken that I ordered on Mother's Day was delicious and I would have given it 5 stars by itself! I had plenty leftover for lunch the following afternoon and it was just as good then. While I didn't enjoy the dish that my sister ordered as much (some kind of fried beef covered in sauce), it's one of her favorite dishes here. We had really good service despite it being a busy holiday and got free wontons in chocolate sauce at the end of our meal. The only negative aspect was that we were apparently seated right under an air conditioning vent because it was FREEZING! I overheard the table that was later seated beside us complain to the server that it was too cold, but there wasn't really anything they could or would do about it. All in all, it was one of the better Chinese/Asian restaurants I've tried since moving to Arizona.

sQ0n3Y4G6Wnh1DNI4qT0YA.text: Went to Flo's in Tempe for the first time, it was Halloween evening, so we were served by a very tall hot dog w/mustard, the service was good, thank you Andrew! We started off w/two glasses of wine and the vegetable potstickers, they were about the best I've had and the dipping sauce was delicious. I ordered the Spicy Cinnamon Shrimp, it was beyond  excellent, very rich  and completely different than any dish I have ever eaten, this alone will keep me coming back to Flo's! The fried strips of crepe were a nice added touch to the dish and yummy. i needed a box to take the leftovers home. My dinner companion had the Pine nut Shrimp and said it was a bit bland but the broccoli was cooked to perfection. The portions are nice, not overly 'loaded' w/food, the prices are very reasonable and the atmosphere is comfortable and clean. Only one reason I did not give Flo's 5 stars, we were seated on the southwest side of the restaurant, the sun was going down and I had a choice of the sun in my eyes or beating down on my back, my eyes won that decision but our waiter had to wear sunglasses to serve us, there are no blinds to close. I cannot imagine the summer months with the AZ sun interfering with my dining experience, Flo, call your decorator!

l3UENsi7wQifiJxUmv-p3w.text: One of the best Asian restaurants in Tempe!! Food is tasty, menu is limited for Veggies but who cares when you are pure Non-Vegitarian :P Loved the ambience and service was really good. Sure will come back and suggest my friends :)

fatq6UwA_Cw_dAPwIwIOYw.text: Visiting from our of town. Went to Flo's for dinner with a group of 8. Great food, quick service great ambiance. Definitely would return.

R0Ofe279V5UXxzTRg_zZgg.text: without a doubt, the best around. happy hour. excellent, my favorites is the calamari and the chicken wings, a must have..and everything else excellent. I try and make it thier at least twice a month ..half price on appitizers and drinks from 3-7, did i say happy hour..m-f..

pL_7I4dP7WPfwBJEt1ktTw.text: First off, the food and the prices are outstanding. As for the dining experience, pathetic comes to mind. Whoever the Architect was that converted the old McDonald's (Tempe location) has absolutely no concept of noise management. It kind of reminded us of a high school cafeteria. The place is an echo chamber and you can't even hear the person sitting next to you. I was in a party of 10 on Saturday night and every single one of us was thankful to leave. We actually stood in the parking lot for 20 minutes (110 degree heat) talking because we couldn't do so inside. What a shame because $1000.00 could fix it.

yErRqH9u5SjDGX_t-cxT1g.text: Went for lunch today.  Place looked great inside.  We had lunch off of the appetizer menu.  Lettuce wraps were fantastic, as were pot stickers.  Our waitress was Stephanie, and she took good care of us.  I was really impressed with the whole place and am glad to see this type of food available.  We would not hesitate to try it for dinner as well.  I found the price to be very reasonable for the quality.

TutVVlecoM76KgHup8_0EA.text: I have eaten here several times now since it opened and Tempe and it just seems to keep getting better and better.  Now they have outside seating which is even better!  I have been turning all my co-workers on to Flo's and they have all like it.  The ambience is awesome!

cezqTIvJ-tC0ixn6AsAcng.text: I rated this restaurant so low because we had to wait over an hour for our food, food wasn't bad but the service so bad, not sure I will be going there again.

HdHwWpKDL2jvHqnQpqqw-A.text: Absolutely love this restaurant! Very clean and great atmosphere. The food is always good, fresh, and very well seasoned. They have really good lunch specials also.

DK9z42AFf14wAL4lt4Ux7A.text: Gave this place two tries. The service staff is friendly, but the food is not good at all. Hot and sour and wonton soups are bland at best. I tried shrimp and pine nuts and Mongolian beef, and I would not recommend either. A friend ordered teriyaki chicken which looked great but did not taste good. My guess is that the cooks are not tasting the food before serving to check quality. A disappointing experience for a restaurant I had high hopes for.

yd74rhYufWzWFt-8OfBr4w.text: We just got back from lunch at Flo's! I am surprised it was not busier but we did go at 11 AM so maybe we beat the crowd. I had the lemon sauce chicken and the sauce was nice and sweet and the chicken was thin and crispy which is exactly how I like it! The lunch comes with a side salad first with their yummy dressing. We are going to add Flo's to our lunch options for sure!

zbXPalt7SrqI7WR4pDIn9g.text: I have been wanting to try Flo's for a while now. Today I finally got my chance, but it was so disappointing! I ordered the Panko Chicken Salad and the greens look like a bagged salad from the grocery store (supposed to be mixed greens, but more like iceberg with 3 pieces of baby romaine). It had shredded carrots and NO walnuts (menu description says walnuts). The chicken is just OK. Honestly, this is a McDonald's quality salad for $9.50. I also ordered the edamame appetizer and the pods are slick with oil. Yuck! I am extremely disappointed, will not be returning to Flo's. Bummer, since the menu sounds so good- but obviously is not.

BTIl22IKRUAkpBugGGYNaQ.text: If you love Asian food you need to try Flo's reasonable prices & food is off the chart. OMG!! happy hour is fabulous

P7KaY3wPQG69MpJhV4ea7A.text: This location just opened in June and I finally stopped in last night with friends to check it out.  SO glad we did!  There were six of us so I had the opportunity to try a bit of everything!  Such a great menu and I couldn't find a dish on our table that wasn't awesome!  A bit pricey, but well worth it!

pT8FtBXR319MfUamQyOUDA.text: Very average.  Very overpriced.  Very disappointing.  We order $90 worth of take-out to try this restaurant and will not return.  Of 5 entrees and 4 appetizers, only the moo shu pork was worth recommending.  The lettuce wraps were bland...almost tasteless...and there were only 4 pot stickers per order (most places its 6 or 8).  The mongolian beef was OK but the garlic chicken & kung pao chicken were average at best.  Don't believe the hype...the recent reviews of Bryan M. and Julie M. are right, Flo's is just plain disappointing.

U_ExwvkfjGvEC_S4gYznzw.text: I've always been a big fan of Flo's growing up in the valley. I just visited the Tempe location, visiting from New York, and picked up a to go order for me and my friends (mu shu, katsu chicken, lo mein, pad Thai, and beef noodle soup). We get home to discover there are no pancakes for our mu shu. We call to let the restaurant know only to be asked if we "actually checked for the pancakes"  after being put on hold. After telling the hostess answering the phone we didn't have a car to come get the pancakes (visiting/hotel = no car) she said "there is really nothing I can do for you then." Disappointed in the customer service to say the least.

qU_RNSssTK6pgZENqMfbyA.text: It was good, but it was overpriced for quantity and what you got. Guess I'll go back if I really need to. Will definitely investigate less expensive options. I think it's the most I've ever paid for Asian food. Was desperate for a quick meal. Wasn't all that quick even

3VL2VOfqF1X-DrbCnRoVyA.text: The service tonight was absolutely amazing and we were well taken care of.  Flo the manager was exceptional and the waiter was awesome!  Your food is fabulous as always and I can't thank you enough for everything.   I will always recommend your locations to others and next time I will come see you in Scottsdale!

l1he-S0K-vmD5pp_SgrhEg.text: This is hands down the best Asian restaurant in the valley. Happy hour is from 4-7, seven days a week, with half price appetizers and drinks. Everything I've eaten here has been fantastic. The spicy shrimp and pork wontons and house roast pork are to die for. I'm coming in next week for the Peking duck.

3-EQFaXxW3qYxBm8Vlb_fw.text: Walked in and very surprise with music and atmosphere not good and noise. Very bland food with no salt nor peppers on table. All come with salad that i was ready to ask if it was bagged. Employee not very happy to be there and not knowledgeable on food. Please don't waist the money, i had better at a fast food restaurant.

fYQGMnlGEK9gZlUoUAQg8w.text: Delicious food at a modest price.  I got the orange chicken and asked them to spice it up. They brought it out really quick, almost frighteningly quick. With it came a side of rice.  I went there on a date and really enjoyed the experience. My only concern was that the walls were plain, but that's just a little hurdle to get past.  Thumbs up!

vPQHIZnaBkTlRQ1syYKFmQ.text: I always start off with the words "Yelp brought me here" followed by what I've read and I always find I get great service and in this case the server added a complimentary desert. Either way this place has awesome food, a full bar and a very friendly staff. Oh and get this... They have HAPPY HOUR EVERYDAY between 3-7 yes you heard it here first including weekends which would make it "Happier Hour". I had a local IPA from the good people at San Tan brewery in chandler called the Hop Scotch IPA and I always order the pad Thai dish when trying a new place and it did not disappoint. If you're in the area stop in trust me!

HfuKWOA2njs3nlIHVIC-1w.text: This place is awesome! I had the Red Chicken Curry. The flavors were amazing! Never had curry that good. Everything seemed really fresh and cooked perfectly. There are plenty great dishes that you can chose from and the service was great. Ill defiantly be going back soon!

BTkvp6i8cV787_fy8mPrEQ.text: The drinks were excellent and the happy hour prices are good. Food is pretty lackluster - bland except for being over salted and fairly Americanized.

m-eUtkaYigxeOdJfEYrOfQ.text: A seemingly fresher Chinese takeout but lacking in flavors. Placing the takeout order by phone was problematic. It seems the person did not know the menu well, so we were off to a bad start anyway. Then the food overwhelmed me.

5nOB34q9ue1pVTU5jDXwxg.text: New location opened in Tempe at Rural and Baseline, its actually located in a former McD's but you wouldn't know it by walking inside. They have a nice long bar area and the dining area is large and open. The menu is huge and varies between chinese, thai and other asian fusion.  They have lettuce wraps that are delicious and the Pad Thai, Pork Lo Mein and Shrimp in Lobster sauce are all good choices.  Go in for Happy Hour or on Saturdays when the menu is $6 from noon - 3!  Such a deal.

xpNffaNz1HiF_v5DT86eMg.text: Have been back twice since my initial visit.. Not too pricey but fast and delicious food with fantasic waiting staff and a pleasent decor

Pv8u6SKNnPi98H35SM2Erw.text: My first time to Flo's, I needed take out, I craved curry, but saw the Asian Peanut Chicken on the menu and knew I had to have it.  I called in,  first thing,  the guy taking my order didn't rush me.   Second,  their chicken isn't breaded,  yeah!  Third, I wanted extra veggies and he was kind enough to read me off the selections.   I got exactly what I wanted,  on time.  I ended up splitting it with my two kids. They were way more interested in my dinner then pizza.  I split the rice and dinner between 3 of us and we are stuffed.   The veggies were perfectly done,  still crisp, the sauce was full of flavor and the chicken was the right size and tender!   I will definitely be trying other amazing things!

lQQhXtrmV_0PNRUamkkLhg.text: Great prices, nice atmosphere, and the food is fantastic.  This is the best Asian restaurant around by leaps and bounds.

iGYyZDGP8BGnHMJ_cfr7oQ.text: Yum Yum Yum!!! This is a newer place in Tempe, a sister property of the one in North Scottsdale.  Having been to the Scottsdale location I was hoping for good things when I saw the Tempe location opened in the Whole Foods complex.  They did not disappoint!  Food is extremely fresh, Asian flair, I had the Pad Thai with shrimp, calamari (not great) but overall a very good experience with good staff!  Would definitely return!

TLFANAR7jbixAHGRCQir2Q.text: Love, love this place for good Asian food. The atmosphere is a good place for a first date or nice evening out with your sweetie or girls day with your bffs.

PXhX5nkvTKRVISndTAg9iw.text: We went to flows this weekend amd absolutely loved our experience.  The food is always so good and authentic. I would recommend it ro all asian food lovers

8aZXlGi6xfy1Sy2-llHOKA.text: I came here for lunch one day since it's down the street from my work.   I ordered the chicken Katsu. Instead of white rice it actually comes with friend rice which I thought was a good twist. The Katsu was good. Remember this isn't Onos or L&L so you're not going to get the best Katsu ever. But it was good. For drinks I got the Mandarin Oriental. Omg! For $9 a drink, you definitely get your money's worth. I actually thought it was a bit too strong. Each sip was like taking a shot each time.   I thought their dishes were a bit pricey. We're talking around $12 a plate. It would be nice if they had lunch specials. They have a very big menu so there's definitely a lot of items to try.

photos.caption: Photo of Flo's - New Asian Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States. Mandarin oriental
Photo of Flo's - New Asian Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chicken katsu

4DtACBvQ3R6GCmi6wavovA.text: My favorite Tempe locale for some taste you food. Snuck in before happy hour and they were great about getting two beer orders and some appetizers. Great service.  Eclectic patrons with happy servers. Gonna keep going here.

evQvbue9ZRJRh2S5zCMAHA.text: I love this place! I've been a big fan of Flo's since her first restaurant opened in Scottsdale. This location is awesome, as well. I just had the most wonderful lunch in a great atmosphere, with an attentive and friendly server. On top of all that, it was $10! I had my favorite lettuce wraps, and Flo's crisp and fresh salad with the yummy Flo's dressing. I'll be back again and again!

_74eR0NZrAG0Nl64m5Vqmw.text: Our monthly group dinner.  I ate at one of their locations in Scottsdale.  We order several dishes and shared:  Beef with Wide noodles, Lettuce Wrap, Fried Tofu & vegetables, Katsu Chicken, Salt & Pepper Calamari, Singapore Chicken Satay, Spicy Ginger Onion Beef & Twice Cooked Pork.  It was all good, tasty and well prepared.  Our waitress was very quick, accommodating and friendly.  I wouldn't mind coming here again, when in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Flo's - New Asian Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States. Fried Tofu &amp; Vegetables
Photo of Flo's - New Asian Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States. Salt &amp; Pepper Calamari
Photo of Flo's - New Asian Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States. Spicy Ginger-Onion Beef

NU4nLyTE_ftmgmjhq0Z9DQ.text: This place will always be my favorite Asian food. I highly recommend this place to anyone.

nGjOCMz1xZayW44R9kODlw.text: This place was okay as far as casual atmosphere goes, not a place to dress up for. It reminds me of something between a cafeteria and a cafe, nothing spectacular. But if you want a quick bite to Easter i guessed it was more of a casual cafe.

RHQUKwZr8dPiRQXEw0RDwQ.text: My all time favorite place to get some good Asian food. I used to live right next door to the location in Scottsdale. So happy I still have a location near me.

OEuIIgjGdoRR7YwC-ePnqg.text: It's always fun to see new restaurants come up in the area & an Asian Fusion restaurant is definitely right up my alley. We had some evening plans so we just got a couple of dishes to go from Flo's.  The first thing we noticed when we walked in was that the interior is very modern & sleek-looking. There's quite a bit of sit-down seating as well as a few seats at the bar.  After a look over the menu, I wanted to try something different but ended up ordering the Kung Pao chicken with white rice and my date got the Singapore BBQ Pork Noodles.  The Kung Pao chicken was fine but I found myself wishing there was a little bit more flavor & spice. Also, the veggies that were tossed in with the chicken were different than what you usually find in this dish. It all tasted just okay. The Singapore BBQ Pork Noodles were definitely different and interesting. I didn't get too many bites but I thought the ones I did seemed mostly bland. Typically noodle dishes aren't served with rice but this one was.  I thought that the price was not justified. The dishes were both much more expensive than I was expecting in the first place, and then after eating what was served, I didn't find it was worth it. My date did not eat any of the rice so I think it would've been better to have an option of not getting rice and paying a little bit less for that entree. Overall, I don't feel like I have much of a reason to return.

photos.caption: Photo of Flo's - New Asian Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States. Kung Pao Chicken to-go.

zkP15bE5m9IJEi_zI90DQA.text: Love their happy hour.  Food is good beer is great. Excellent spot to hangout after work

hr5GzldipWL87HT7yU6fag.text: Found this place courtesy of the yelp folks- thank you.  Started with lettuce wraps. I think the portion was easily sized for two - but I destroyed the platter. Really tasty and very hot! (Temp not spicy)The sauces were very good. There was a hot sauce with a texture of salsa but the taste of Thai hot sauces. Excellent sauces.  Then I thought I would try the tom yum soup. The bowl was large enough for 3 and filled to the brim.  The fresh mushrooms were very good, the shrimp a bit boiled.   Would have liked to try an entree but too full. Ordered chicken fried rice - to go!! Great, attentive service. The server was a bit snooty with an air of wanting to be elsewhere. But the rest of the staff was excellent.  Putting it on my places to try again

4_1PlzNtt94W4A-_H0wuPQ.text: One of our favorite place to have Asian food. We are always content with Singapore noodles. We have had plenty of their dishes and always delish. One thing I may change is their fried rice. Recently we have seen and tasted that it's a bit different. It lacks the brownness of it  which is probably the soy sauce and egg. Other than that it's delicious.

cQs21brw-TH4Y-lyZzWwmw.text: This is a pretty unique concept. Their food selection seems authentic which I like. They have Thai food, Vietnamese well pho, and Chinese. I like their food selections. We came here for happy which is from 3-7pm. Very affordable and huge portions! The place is clean and spacious! This place is good for family dinners as well!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Flo's - New Asian Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States. Spicy calamari and Lao lettuce cups. Very good!!!

K38wwpoqoEiPKM9jtF3ryw.text: I met up with a friend for an after work dinner outing. I was looking forward to a calorie conscious meal as I'd researched their menu online a few days before. That's not what I got.  The service was good. I was politely greeted seated quickly. While I waited for my friend and water and the menus were promptly delivered. Our table was right in front of the door and I contemplated asking for a new table but realized it was the only table for two in sight. Yes, I could have asked, but whatever. It was a table.   For dinner I asked for the teriyaki chicken skewers and a side salad with the ginger dressing on the side as I like to control the amount of dressing that I have. The salad arrived first, but dressing was NOT on the side. I looked around for our waiter but he was no where in sight. Oh dang it...I'll just eat it as is.  The dressing was pretty yummy and the salad was fresh.   Then came our meal (which were on the appetizer menu) and I knew that the chicken was not grilled but fried. Oh cr*p. I didn't ask how it was prepared. My bad. It was a pretty hefty portion with about 6 skewers. Not bad.  Then I took a bite and wow...not what I expected at all. The chicken was "bouncy" and not tender and juicy. It was fried (or broiled) I think and pretty oily. The teriyaki sauce was very, very salty and I knew my rings would be tight the next day. (I was right.)     On the other hand, my friend's dish looked amazing! She had the lettuce wraps and they looked super fresh.  She said it was yummy and practically ate the whole thing. Again, the portion was sizable.   As another Yelper mentioned, It was pretty loud and at times I couldn't hear what my friend was saying. The noise was distracting.   Since I was looking OUT of the restaurant toward the door, I didn't really take in the interior decor so can't comment there.    I'm not sure I'll be back. I was not wow'ed and to me Chicken Teriyaki is super simple to make. I could probably do better at home. ;)

SqOmvO33oX6s6FjyGEtE9g.text: Who doesn't love Flo's!  This review is only for their lunch menu, but let's face it - it is all delicious! The lunch menu is such a great deal for the food that is prepared for you. Tried the chicken chow fun and katsu chicken, and both dishes were fresh and extremely tasty. My mother and I both said, "Wow, this fried rice is amazing!" I would highly recommend for anyone needing an option to select. We both needed To Go boxes to bring the rest of our food home!  The interior decor kind of relaxes me and feels zen. I will be a regular of Flo's as long as their around!

photos.caption: Photo of Flo's - New Asian Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chow fun!
Photo of Flo's - New Asian Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States. Katsu Chicken
Photo of Flo's - New Asian Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chow Fun!

8d36fAmC2lfqFWihry6RQg.text: It can be hard for me to find well cooked tofu so I was so excited to finally find a place for awesome tofu Asian dishes! Really good food, friendly and attentive service and the atmosphere was really cool.   **Update: They recently changed their menu and some of the food items that were favorites are now either gone or not as good. It's a bummer for us.

m2J9lrwq262OkkZ9y6c2dQ.text: Their happy hour specials are great. Don't pass on the wings, they are worth the wait. I don't think the food here is as good as the Scottsdale location, although I haven't eaten there in a few years. The menu is hit and miss. I love their mushu pork and katsu chicken. Some of the other items are generic, so so Chinese takeaway staples.

D_eCjIVIWXB1GTpNWNnbHQ.text: First off I'm a well Hung Chinese chef   Meh..  Are used to go to the original location in north Scottsdale about a decade ago and it was fantastic.  We tried a few different items here and they were all very bland and I can honestly say you're much better off just going to panda express. It is literally about that quality. Perhaps a bit lower now.  We ordered for items and two of them had to be sent back. The two we kept were average at best.  Definitely will not be back.

QATylcoykPej0Dka8glUKg.text: Great happy hour and it lasts till 7pm! CHEERS to that!  Half price all drinks and appetizers. The chicken wings are delicious! The service has been slow but only when all tables are full and that is understandable. They are doing something right!

aIPo1z3fgELsy9kG2gEQoQ.text: What a great surprise and a gem of a find! While some of the servers are quite young and clearly learning the ropes (we all learn somewhere, sometime), the service was excellent and the food was great. It is shocking that this place was a McDonalds for many, many years, you'd never know it,...and I know it! They did a fantastic job remodeling and rebuilding to make it very open, lively, warm, welcoming and a fun atmosphere.  The food was excellent!  All the ingredients were clearly fresh and each plate made to order. Spices were alive and spot on. Drinks were excellent! We went during happy hour and the value was incredible!! We had 4 or 5 appetizers, where were all good size and 2 drinks and the bill was less than $30,...and we were both stuffed and very, very satisfied! The manager stopped by to say hi and he was a super friendly, knowledgeable, caring guy, that was great.  This is seriously one of the best restaurants in the area. We only had appetizers and drinks but the entrees on the other tables looked delicious and huge and steamy hot!! I can't wait to go back and try them. If they are as good as the apps and drinks we had, I may need to "up" my review to even higher.  Really, stop in and try this hidden little gem, you won't be sorry!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Flo's - New Asian Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chicken lettuce wraps, huge portions, beautiful presentation!
Photo of Flo's - New Asian Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States. Great atmosphere!

LFJ7lXQ9s5wII4Z3r49tTg.text: The lunch and dinner menu here is fabulous. The food is always so good and fresh! Service is professional and attentive. Been here several times and have always left feeling full and satisfied. I always enjoy the Katsu Chicken on the dinner menu. The only downside in my opinion is the dining area is a bit loud. It can be hard to have a conversation. If you sit at the bar it's nicer and easier to converse.

d-4xV8mi0sabAOJALLBoTA.text: Went there for an early dinner today and the good and the service was excellent.  Very clean and sparkling.  Will definitely be back soon

xBMiWSETuCi6H6EVEkZJLg.text: Good food, although I wish they'd not used so much soy sauce.  Also, since I ordered an appetizer and a main dish, I wish they had given me a chance to finish the appetizer before bringing out the main dish. It wasn't that crowded; they didn't need to bustle me out in order to turn the table.   Good service, though.

h8Lghzx_78iO3ZcjNIxYkw.text: Great food, ambiance and service. Thank you Flo for bringing your great food to the Tempe area! You are the best!

Zpbh7LrMoLRxbx6PDLo7yA.text: Good service. Nice restaurant. The food is not very good though. At least what I ordered. I ordered Kung Pao Chicken. It came out too quick. You could tell that it was processed pre-cooked chicken that they just flash fried really quick. Very fatty not good quality chicken at all.  Will try this place one more time or another dish but if it's the same quality I will be not back again.

NON8xbXHXWOo9nl0yXVpLA.text: Wonderful  service and food from start to finish. Fast service. Hot food. Our waitress was super nice and all wait staff and bussers  were super friendly  as well. I was very impressed  on how clean the restaurant was as well. Prices were awesome. And we went during happy hour so appetizers were way cheaper.  It was $50 after tip. We got drinks, 2 appetizers,  soup,  and 2 meals. We had plenty of leftovers.

FGM8Yt1y71DwB4A4ZxMOpA.text: Having been to the Scottsdale location about 6 months ago we gave this location a try. Straight-up, it was LOUD including screaming kids on a Saturday @6pm (PEAK). Our server was great and tended to recommend veggie dishes, which this body could use more of. I had the Yuxiang Pork with eggplant per our server's suggestion...great, with a delicious sauce! The menu is quite varied including Curry's & Thai options. Happy Hour will get you ridiculous prices for Apps & Drinks....think, 21.6oz TsingTao beers @ $3!!! plus crab puffs & pot stickers as well for half price!....our party easily over ate apps and were then presented with family sized entrees. I tend to judge chinese places by the Hot & Sour soup...in this case, Excellent!  I say plan on sharing or over eating, your choice.

IRMsvOvTSUQ0UN4AdXXH-w.text: Very disappointed. The menu looked great and the restaurant looks nice, but the food is just awful. Ordered shrimp skewers and spicy orange chicken. The shrimp was probably the worst shrimp I have ever had. The orange chicken comes with the sauce on the side. Sauce was decent but the chicken, which was breaded and fried, was awful. Really chewy and had a strange texture.   I know this restaurant was converted from an old McDonald's and sadly I wished I had gone across the street to McDonald's instead.

_u8ZZt6i4AAWLeK_6MnjZw.text: Delicious food and great service! Our waters stayed filled and the happy hour deals are amazing! This is a place gives quality everything and they are not over priced. The manager is so sweet and our server was extremely patient with my million questions. This was my first time at Flo's and it we not be my last! #WeAreNotSorryWeOrderedTheCalamari

photos.caption: Photo of Flo's - New Asian Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States. Nothing survived! The food was too good to leave any behind!

uEZ6_UXYb-mA0God2sQIoQ.text: Love Flo's! This is a great casual restaurant. It's Asian Fusion - my favs been the appetizers, curry dishes and the pad Thai. They also have a ridiculous happy hour. Half off of all appetizers (except edamame) and half off anything from the bar.   My husband and I just went and we had 2 cocktails (a-flo-ha) and 2 beers, with 4 appetizers: wings (which were really good, crispy and not greasy), lettuce wraps (fresh crunchy lettuce), edamame and spring rolls. All of it was half off on happy hour and cost is only $29! Definitely our new happy hour spot!

FSLn0Q6zkt--OWJa95bziw.text: This is possibly the WORST meal I have ever had.  I don't even know where to start. It was fairly crowded for a Sunday night which I took for a good sign. The wait staff is young but fairly attentive.  Our actual waiter was a bit of a dope and more concerned with the table of 5 chicks in his station.   Appetizers. We ordered the chicken satay. Super sweet and basic. We also ordered the spring rolls. Completely ordinary.    Meals. Eggplant/pork dish. I thought I was going to wear it home. The waiter literally almost sloshed it off The plate and in my lap. I just ended up with a gelatinous spill on the table.  It was so sweet it was almost inedible. Yellow curry was actually edible. Pho was probably the best option but not near as good as my favorite pho joint.   $50 but not my last meal. Bummed. Was hoping it might have promise for my new watering hole.

CLbL4yLCM3qP3fDAMdqg9g.text: I really like Flo's. I always try to hit the one in North Scottsdale when I'm in the area so I was ecstatic that they opened a location in Tempe.   The whole family went tonight. The restaurant is spacious and beautifully appointed and the food was very good, as always. But the service was appalling.  My husband and I took separate cars so I arrived before him with two of our children. When we walked in, we were told they didn't have a table. Just like that, "We don't have a table right now". No offer to put me on the waiting list, nothing. I had to prompt the guy as to what happened next. He said to take a seat, they were cleaning a table. Then, a girl followed up and told me it would be 10 minutes because they were clearing a table.   We got seated in fairly short order though, so that was OK. Our server took awhile to come over. Now, understandably, my husband and other daughter weren't there yet, so I didn't get too fussed. He took our drink orders and said he'd stop back to get our order when our party arrived. My husband and daughter got there and sat down.  The waiter walked by us about 5 times and didn't even acknowledge that he saw the rest of our party. He then came over, plunked my drink on the table and walked away again, without asking my husband and daughter if they wanted a drink. Then he proceeded to walk past us about 5 more times.  He finally came over to take our order. He didn't listen to my husband and put in the wrong order.  Our food came out very quickly but we had to send my husband's back.   So, the short version is, food was good, service was bad. I'm sure I'll be back but this was disappointing.

uO1VdThgOxMD8-SmgT72kA.text: Great service.  The waitress and waiters, the whole staff was kind and so helpful.  They paid attention to us despite larger groups nearby ordering drinks.  I Really felt respected here.  The value is great here too, You get a lot of food for what you pay.  so why the 3 stars?  The food sucks.  Sorry, its the same quality and taste as when Safeway makes Chinese food.  Its was very mediocre.

bf44-b2yPXekJkhgsv7-tQ.text: Just ordered takeout and this is my new fav Asian spot. Cinnamon shrimp was uniquely flavored and delicious. Lettuce wraps were awesome. And chicken with fried rice hit the spot. Can't wait to return and try some other dishes!

TYKfCUGWDdxAW1mC4_tXmA.text: The only thing I would change in this restaurant would be adding booths . I think it would add a more warm and comfortable feeling .   The service was great for lunch . We absolutely loved the egg drop soup ! My husband love the fried rice and he keeps talking about going back for it lol!  I really liked how clean the bathrooms were. The bar was very nicely set up .  I can not wait to try more food !

3vCtrBx3b6oXuDhLvDkvZw.text: My family in Arizona recently discovered this place through word-of-mouth, and when I arrived to visit them we went here to eat lunch after they picked me up at the airport. My brother and I split a giant bowl of pho (my mother, the vegetarian, passed because it had a meat broth). The pho was wonderful and came with a plate of add-ins and sauces, plus smaller bowls for us to ladle our individual portion into.  We also ordered entrees which were good, solid versions of Asian food.  My mother, the vegetarian who also wants gluten-free food, was a little disappointed because her entree came with noodles, which she was not expecting and was unwilling to eat. That having been said, she didn't ask the server about gluten-free options before ordering, and there may have been some. If you are averse to eating gluten, you might want to ask before ordering.  Flo's wasn't crowded at 1 pm when we were there, but I'm told it does get crowded at other times.  It was a great place for me to eat and enjoy the sunshine and appreciate being on the ground again, and I hope to go back!

93O9USSlXkW9OyNhS6eyvA.text: First time at Flo's last night and I was impressed!   My partner and I wanted to take my parents out for dinner and since my mother loves Asian food, we decided to try something different.   We all shared several different appetizers and dishes and the food was full of flavor and fresh!! We might of found a new favorite Asian restaurant.   The establishment was clean and sleek looking. It wasn't too hectic busy, but it was not dead either for a Sunday evening.   The service was great as well. Our server was personable and very helpful.   The prices were lower compared to other Asian establishments I have visited in the past.   I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a different place to eat at.

7ZpMXeVtuHoG058imr-03w.text: We have been eating at Flo's regularly since the tempe location opened. We are big fans of the other ones in Scottsdale.  The food at this location is soooo delicious!!!!  The waiters are  friendly and the manager usually comes around to see if the customer is being taken care of.  Best appetizers and great happy hour! (strong drinks)  Con: It is a bit loud in there.

Fawn9d2580htBqnc6QMkVQ.text: My new happy place when it comes to Asian food. It's trendy, casual but not too informal, the open space is great for groups or if you feel like having a drink at the bar and a solo meal. Kitchen ran smooth, apps were done and entrees quickly followed. Staff is super friendly and our servers had great suggestions to try, and explained the tastes perfectly. Def worth trying something new every visit, been here more than 3 times and haven't been disappointed.

ut0yeIhnUE6-0PyLnm5apg.text: Have you heard the NPR episode where the seafood industry has a problem mislabeling the species of seafood sold and served? The story goes on to discuss an urban myth that pig bungholes are repurposed and sold as calamari strips. I want to tell you; it's not an urban myth. I had them yesterday at Flo's new restaurant in Tempe. Flo's calamari appetizer was as chewy, inelastic, and muscular as you might imagine a pig's bunghole to be. Even my dog, who likes a nice chewy rawhide occasionally, only ate one and left the remainder in her bowl. I avoided the garbage disposal for fear the motor would burn up trying to macerate the tough over-processed protein.  The entree we shared was the chicken fried rice. It was nothing special. We also shared a 16 oz. bottle of Tsing Tao Beer, my favorite, but we wondered when we paid the $33.00 tab if we'll ever be back. And it's a shame, Flo's location is very convenient to where we live.  I have to add, our server Bethany, was charming and attentive to our requests. For Bethany, we give the extra star otherwise Flo's only deserves one star.

318z8NVquooqsqFTkkXGuw.text: I've gotten advertisements in my mail for this place and was curious about trying. I don't think I will ever go again. There was hardly anyone there when we went inside at lunchtime. The manager seemed nonchalant about us when we walked in. At least he wasn't ignoring us but the overall sterile atmosphere contributed to my overall not-super feeling about the restaurant. Our waiter, although he was very nice, could have been a newbie and when asked of different dishes didn't really give too much detail that gave indication of the dish. Granted he probably didn't know enough about Asian cuisine to comment but it would help in the future. The less than mediocre appetizer of 4 potstickers (too doughy and not browned enough) for $7.50 gave us a clue to what was to come for our main dishes. In my mind I gave them the benefit of the doubt that it's hard to find good potstickers anywhere. But our main dishes were around the same identity...less than mediocre with flavors of inauthenticity that one would appreciate if they shopped at the Fry's "Asian" section. The garlic eggplant that I ordered was hardly seasoned while the other dishes that the others got were too Salty or lacked sauce where it needed (ie in the Curry) to soak up the rice.   The waiter was trying to be nice and ask us if we wanted anything from the appetizer list to rectify our doughy potstickers. We declined. Ok so I thought he was done being new and trying to help the situation but later he came way too fast to ask about the check and made us feel rushed (not good). The manager came over as well to ask about our food and while I think he sensed our disappointment he didn't inquire further which in a restaurant like this where there were hardly any people dining and servers galore, there should be time for them to come and really learn about a diner's experience. That never happened. Hmm well I'm getting tired of writing negative things so will wrap it up.   If you are interested in going to a higher end Panda Express or Pei Wei than this is your place by don't expect to get authentic and tasty food for the price you pay. I understand it's hard to get good "Asian fusion" or even figure out what Asian fusion food is but Flo's please don't call it that because of dishes like "Pad Thai" and "Vindaloo" that you have on the menu. Call it that when you have unique Asian inspired dishes and people who care about your experience.

wjo82rUPNGq4LvtzOSXulg.text: Flo's never disappoints!  From a friendly greeting at the door to kind and efficient servers.  The food always tastes fresh and the service is world class.  The crispy, spicy chicken is a solid gold standard on their menu! This was the best repurposing of an old McDonalds restaurant ever!

Nlxcfv5lTXm7NJnC9K45AQ.text: The Flo's location on Baseline has a lovely atmosphere and a variety of food options as well  healthier, feel-good alternatives. The prices are a little higher than they should be, but their happy hour is cheaper and well worth it.

rDYHxI5v-3P0vTuuqRKSOg.text: Salt and Pepper wings are soooo good!  I have been to this location a few times and it's very good!  Good service, clean, and fresh.

BdP5oHDLX77uNVRcjoo_tw.text: We really enjoyed the atmosphere and food. We love that we don't have to drive to Scottsdale to get their food. We have liked everything we have tried and can't wait to come back. The weather is perfect for the patio area. The aero was great. They didn't clear the table as quickly as the Scottsdale location.

15QndCfW34FuseaWUn3h1A.text: We have been here several times and the last couple just didn't leave me with the want to come back. When I tried again, I leave disappointed. This time, We were greeted by a gal who clearly didn't want to be there and had an attitude problem, I assume she could have been the manager and in her 30s with long dark hair. The food tonight was very salty, egg drop soup and chicken katsu. Jared was our server, very nice and checked on us. Chances are this is our last visit here, I know they could do much better.

jVrJ_WLQ0i4Q_6nuV-t-Sg.text: The place was busy on a Friday at noon so we sat outside under a nicely placed umbrella and when the waitress lowered the music the 4 of us enjoyed talking and eating! Shrimp Pad Thai was okay. Would have liked more Pad Thai and not the other half of the plate of brown rice. Others had the beef and snow peas, and others ate the soy and garlic eggplant meal...all with brown rice. Passionfruit ice tea and I liked the green iced tea.

yrX64_qoCdDbEvL8GTIHlw.text: This is one of my favorite Asian restaurants. I like that it has a slick modern look with an open dining area. Mostly I love the crab puffs, which are some of the best I've ever eaten. I have never ordered anything that I haven't enjoyed. The wait staff is always friendly and helpful. We'll be back.

1ZyFP8k7k2gOAkRqC-51ag.text: Went to pickup a big order, bought several items including to dinner sized house fried rice, no shrimp at all,  very small portions for a ridiculous price, I do not recommend this place just not worth the cost.

BdfL9f4KimlwU5Fe0m9Rcw.text: Average food, average service, average prices and thereby an average rating. This place is nothing out of the ordinary. We primarily decided to go here because of decent ratings and reviews, but weren't really impressed with anything. First of all, they seated us right next to the entrance door, saying that the rest of the area "was closed", although I could clearly see people eating there. After requesting several times, we got a better seat, and shortly after we were seated in the "closed" section, a group of 10 people were seated there. Seriously guys? We ordered the green curry chicken, and the scallops/mushrooms as entrees, both were okay at best. Definitely a one time eat place, life is too short for just ordinary! :-)
