fu82FxpLylTiypNeOsp3GQ.text: The crispy honey beef was the crispiest I ever remember. Not quite burned, but not moist or chewy like usual.  My experiences with Flo's started years ago and I was always impressed with rapid excellent service.    Presentation is great, lunch is reasonably priced and fast.  I get stuck on my favorites, but they have a lot of choices on the menu.  The decor is modern and fun, and it can be informal or dressy.

cVgmjjo6rlpT2ZYkOhmTag.text: The reason I am giving it a 3 at this point is because this place has changed so much in the last year. The food is still good. But they were a great spot to come for happy hour and they are not no more. They changed the menu up and do not offer the same best HH prices as they once used to. Their staff has changed, though still a few familiar faces still remain (by a thread I assume). This place has lost its value. The bartenders are seriously not the greatest and their ppl skills could use some more fine tuning. They have increased their pho which used to be $11 to now $16. Mind you nothing changed in the pho, you don't get anything extra, just less. What used to cost us $30 (sake bomb, 2 appetizers and a soup, plus tip) now costs us $60!!!!! Their management has changed and definitely not the same. It's just sad because used to be our favorite spot and would come here at least 2 to 3 times a week and now I just dislike coming here and have been coming less and less. Today however I don't see us coming back unfortunately

cKuTGI05iJYbQVZqCpUB_A.text: My family has been enjoying Flo's for a few years. We have some favorites, Crispy Honey Beef, Sweet and Sour Chicken, Cashew Chicken, and Pot stickers, but we always get the Lettuce Cups. So good! Great service, friendly staff and a great happy hour.

zyKEOebOYgVbgyD38n2clw.text: You know it's not authentic when they give your party forks instead of chopsticks, lol.  To their credit, the food wasn't terrible tasting... but it's whitewashed Chinese food. And not GOOD Americanized-style Chinese food (think Panda Express - greasy and yummy, Americanized) but rather... just... very bland "Chinese" food.  The venue itself is super clean and nice, and the servers are lovely people.  Go here if you are too nervous to try authentic Chinese food but want to feel multicultural for a day. Don't worry, they won't give you chopsticks unless you ask.

G5GKEzijcPAEJAc6nvhS-A.text: First, the modern concept and set up is cool!  Makes you feel welcome and a clean feel to it too.  I found my friends there were 1 hour before me and happy already from happy hour.  LOL!  OH, they have a great HH menu for drinks and food.  The service was OK.  We needed to keep flagging down our server for refills, additional orders, etc.  Since I was only stopping for the ornament exchange, I ordered the Singapore Chicken Satay and Chicken Pot Stickers.   I got my satay and never got my chicken pot stickers.  Had to grab the servers attention to make sure the chicken pot stickers were removed from my check.  TOO bad the chicken satay was very good, and I left hungry!

photos.caption: Photo of Flo's - New Asian Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States. Singapore Satay chicken

LvLaICSFh2de7zDU4ynJ0g.text: I've been to the other Flo's restaurants in Scottsdale and I have always had a great dining experience so I was happy to discover a Flo's on the south side of town. Since it was part of the other restaurants, I expected the same level of quality service and food at this location but was really surprised.  Oh gosh, the experience was way off...  REVIEW OF SERVICE:  The waiter must have been new because his explanation of some of the dishes wasn't really helpful.  Additionally, we were in mid-bite when he came over, said it looked like we were wrapping up, and asked if we wanted the check. what.the.fuck. The restaurant was only 15% full, you need to make room for imaginary customers?  Also, usually at Flo's the salad comes out really quick but for some reason today, the salad took quite a while and it was thrown onto the plate so half-assed, it was spilling onto the table when they served it.   Also when the food was delivered, the waitress practically whispered the name of the dish while trying to move it to the table. We had to ask her what dish it was so we could direct her on where to put it.   The restaurant had a lot of employees but the quality of the service was just lacking. Sad really because I brought two friends who hadn't ever been to a Flo's and I'm not sure if they'll try any of the other locations after having such a bad experience.   REVIEW OF THE FOOD:   The pot stickers were steamed and fried like they were supposed to be but they were pretty doughy and the sauce they gave us was really shallow so we had to move the dumpling around in the sauce dish to get some flavor on the dumpling...  Imagine trying to take a bath in 4 inches of water in your tub-  yeah, it was like that.   The eggplant dish was poorly cooked.  One bite into the eggplant and the whole veggie would explode with water. The water completely diluted the flavor which made it feel like we were eating a sponge.  The curry chicken was decent but didn't have much sauce which is funny because to cook that dish, one would need quite a bit of sauce because the chicken, green beans and basil leaves were all evenly coated with sauce but the presentation of it was like a semi-dry curry dish.  Hardly any sauce at all.  SUMMARY:  I can't come back to this location. The other locations are great but this one just seemed like a waste of money.

T889MJl0Q6ySrfrLuof3sg.text: I came here during HH so I could try a lot of different appetizers.  I ordered the shumai dumplings, Lao style lettuce cups, and calamari.  I thought everything was great!  The lettuce cups came with a LOT of chicken.  I think it was enough for about 4 people to share that appetizer.  My friend got the spicy wontons, shrimp skewers, and vegetable dumplings.  I tried those and they were also good!  But the spicy wontons weren't noticeably spicy at all.  I like that they take online reservations, even for Saturdays.  I'll definitely be back here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Flo's - New Asian Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States. Lots of apps - calamari, shu Mai, shrimp skewers, vegetable dumplings
Photo of Flo's - New Asian Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States. Lao style lettuce cups-- comes with a LOT of chicken

lpLkzLeuV-x680ikRZHV1A.text: My husband and I went to Flo's last night for the first time and had a great time! We always sit at the bar because we like to meet people. Well this place did not disappoint! Our bartender Kat, was absolutely a joy and made us feel welcome and like she was happy we chose their establishment. She gave us many tips on the food and drinks and even customized our drinks. She was just so fun and really added to our experience. Then there was the food.  Gotta say this, their happy hour is from 3-7!!!! Which is great for me because I can't make it out on Friday till after 6 which is the time every other happy hour stops. We only had happy hour food which is half price on all the starters. We had lettuce cups/wraps, sliced pork, spring rolls and wontons. We loved them all but the lettuce cups!! Next time we will try some of the entries as they looked delicious! If you are thinking about going here you won't be disappointed!  Also, Kat is such a great asset to this business I'm hoping them appreciate her!

55Ng1wSkXvWlScd3V521XA.text: Great happy hour and attentive service! After a long day at work, this is the place to come for mid-week happy hour. Casual, friendly, fast service, and delicious food. The service staff is prompt and extremely attentive. We love this place .

SAMwr6C2E1N771a6q-CdzQ.text: I came here for a girl's afternoon out with my boyfriend's cousin on a Saturday. We were pleasantly surprised to learn about the Saturday special. It was $6.00 at the time, but I've learned that the price has since risen to about $8.00.   This was my second time here and both times were good experiences.   Service: The service was solid. While there was nothing spectacular that happened, sometimes that's a good thing. The waitstaff are consistent with their smiles and politeness. They make you feel welcome even when the restaurant is very crowded. My water and iced tea were filled up constantly.   Food: Flo's is made out to be a fusion-type place, but we chose meals that were pretty standard: a red curry and a chicken stir-fry. I'd say that the quality and authenticity of the food was somewhere between a fast-food place and a home style restaurant. I would eat here again. The Saturday special started with a salad before the actual entree was served.   Ambiance: It's fancier than most Chinese restaurants. You could come here for a business lunch, or just a lunchtime date in shorts and a t-shirt and you wouldn't feel out of place. It's clean too which I really appreciate.   I'd come back here.

DVYA24pUp2D2Il7F141b3g.text: Don't order take out from here! At least!! Though the quality of the food can't possibly be much better when you're eating in either. Ordered sweet and sour chicken and they didn't give any sauce. Who does that? It was just little crumbly looks like bacon but it isn't fried chicken bits and canned pineapple! And $13!! Don't do it! Flee! The pork shumai tasted like food poisoning so I only ate one of them. $6! Fleeee!

photos.caption: Photo of Flo's - New Asian Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States. Gross

ce14AINbBpxbsSTZ1VnEVw.text: Love this place. The best happy hour ever. Half price appetizers, half price drinks, and the food is amazing. This is our new favorite local hang out place in south Tempe.

L6iinXaP6QCXpUwZovvbQA.text: I live right across the street from this place and have been wanting to try it out. Today, my boyfriend and I finally had the chance to go.  Long story short,  food was pretty good but service was lacking so much so we would only go back if it was for takeout.  We were one of two tables in the restaurant and served by Stephanie.  The staff,  manager included, were more concerned eating their lunch in a group at the back of the restaurant to be focused on how ours (the guest) was.  Working in the restaurant industry I know what good attentive service looks like and this place needs some work.

UHEdjV1MNvBO1igJ8Uj_Tg.text: The best burritos I ever have in around this area and it is very closed to where I worked that I can pick up my lunch in a few minutes. I came here sometimes and planned come back sometime in the near future! More I can say that I truly recommended!

Cbz0kYAkbBnubF21QmE2mg.text: Love this restaurant !! Food is excellent.  Great Happy Hour too.  The staff is on top of it all. Can't say enough about Flo's.

ZQjp0Sw8IzcW7WYiovsqHg.text: Went to Flos in tempe for lunch Saturday.  I have gone there at least 6 or 7 times on Saturdays for their lunch which has been very reasonable and the food decent in the past.  This past Saturday the restaurant was busy and the food terrible.  My wife's chicken curry had very old dried out pieces of chicken and her rice was dried out, terrible.  I ordered a shrimp pad thai and it was really bad,  nothing like real pad thai, pretty much egg noodles (large and flat) with a couple of shrimp, bad flavor and again, dried out and old rice.  They add some fried won tons which are really just a waste.  I guess I won't return.

Uj0P7qUHe3iiy5fuVQWzgg.text: Yum! A little noisy but I didn't mind. They did forget the tofu on our rice and only brought out one of the two orders of spring roles we ordered.. They were quick to fix their mistake though. It was very good food with very good service!

iFuJX2jEqou0Bem1v0wSAg.text: This is my new fav way to eat Asian cuisine. Sorry peiwei doesn't even compare now that they cut their portions. I've been to flos 2x for lunch and dinner and the food is DELICIOUS big portions so I have more for later and the service is incrediable. Friendly waiters and people floating to fill drinks and so helpful with doors when I have the baby with me. Greta atmosphere, great food and great service. I'll go here at least 2x a month :)

vqckUlUva0jkY2IcAIZBPQ.text: Holy geesh this place is amazing. So many gluten free options! Healthy too! So good. Coming back for sure. Happy to have this place in the neighborhood.

0e4pGwN9BYUINBC8NOu6tg.text: The food was good, I just took issue with what how they decided to handle a challenge. I ordered my lunch and was given the option of white or brown rice, I chose brown. I was never notified of an issue with my choice and when the waiter brought the food, he dropped it and said "we are out of brown, it will take 15 minutes to cook so I got you white." He never asked if that was ok, never mentioned the problem until my food was in front of me.  On top of that there was no apology or service recovery. I just felt it was just handled poorly with little regard for my happiness.

0yHYNhHS3wbPuzN28zCKKQ.text: Ask for Corey behind the bar and get some great food and happy hour 3-7 all day everyday. Classy new spot but still have PBR on draft.

504BKPNosiZQyQ8-K-EeEg.text: I've been here on multiple occasions and the service has been great. Our waiter was friendly. We were offered water which was nice.   The food is good and flavorful. The skewers are my favorite along with the lettuce wraps. If you are looking for something that is tasty and easy Flo's is the way to go.

TDFD-fM5bbycGg98mjrFvw.text: Customer service is subpar to the quality of the food here . I've ordered the lettuce wraps twice  for take out and twice they've forgotten my lettuce. If the food wasn't so good I wouldn't be so concerned but its delicious . After calling the manager about the second forgotten lettuce incident I then got a personal phone call from Flo . She was extremely personable and understanding and helped me out a lot . It really shows how much you care about your customers.

6GdkYIbOpnMIPugGjeGIfg.text: Flo's has a great happy hour - $2 beer, half price cocktails and wine, and half price appies which are large and really tasty! The lettuce wraps are substantial and great for sharing. I wasn't a fan of the dumplings, but the chicken satay was great. Some nice noodle dishes on the main menu. Incredibly affordable for what you get. Staff were wonderful!

tk_98UBIgFKM4WsBP7_7JA.text: My boyfriend and I just stumbled upon this place tonight and we enjoyed it so much I felt compelled to review.  The food was delicious, fresh, and filling! The staff was great, along with the atmosphere.  Definitely would go back again! Also, for vegans, or gluten free, etc. it is easily specified what it contains as far as allergies on the menu. No matter what your needs, Flo's has many options for all which makes choosing a great dish for everyone fun and easy- just wonderful :)

Ml7n9oaU6daa89RZlJP1-w.text: It's an okay place. I liked 1 out of the 4 dishes that our table ordered. Very clean place and staff was friendly. Expensive for the food though.

jUZXRKQRnqF2OpqrOwH3tQ.text: Amazing! I'm not a typical Asian food lover. Its something I have to be in the mood for. I was in the area at a doctor's appointment and I asked the office where I could find some good healthy food and they said Flo's, right across the street.  I figured I would try it but never expected to find the best Asian food I've ever had! If you want fresh food, excellent service, a large menu, a well kept/ clean, good prices - place to eat - try Flo's. You will not be disappointed! Thank you Stephanie for taking such good care of us. You are wonderful. We will be back to experience more yummys!

GbeHRRg5-_EnxYzs1Sb1YQ.text: Have heard about this place for years and finally went.  Made reservations, but still had to wait 30 minutes, but they did extend Happy Hour prices for us since we had to wait.  Food was good, service very friendly, but it was very noisy.  Once Happy Hour ended at 7pm, it quieted down.  They appear to be extremely busy during the happy hour.  Will definitely go again, but may just get take out.

4LkOQpgsH1PTU1nXIb1mKw.text: My husband and I just moved to the area so we went to Flo's for the first time. The reviews were spot on. Great food, service, and atmosphere. I love that there is a lot of tables, but the way they have them arranged I didn't feel like I was sitting right on top of someone else. Mitch our server was great. Very attentive, but not annoying. The only complaints I have is no WiFi, and the yoga pants the hostess was wearing. Not appropriate for such a classy place. Other than that we had a great time, and a great meal.

jfZYIdgQ7uJ2-9ldOksstg.text: Terrible! The expensive calamari was so chewy I couldn't even get through a single piece, the chicken was unbelievably dry and the sauce that came with it made my stomach hurt, and the pot stickers tasted like they were frozen out of a box (soft and bland). Never eating here again!

VWXo6fVGFj2WPVFDD24QJw.text: We've been to Flo's approximately a dozen times since they opened and we have had excellent service and great food every time.

3pnsHm3UgNqtlaPYsDXUjw.text: Not a fan of the new menu. The calamari is gone and so is Chef Danny's lemon pepper chicken. Chef Danny is completely off the menu. The new 1 sheet menu must cost less to print. But prices are higher to compensate!

55JQweV19UTAVrYqAQR_lA.text: They have redeeemed themselves! I was really craving chicken vindaloo and was in Tempe so decided to see if things had changed.  It was absolutely delicious.  The vindaloo was done perfectly and the service was great. So glad to see that they are now up to the level of the Scottsdale location.

1zQWLwSk337H6r-Sbt94rw.text: Went here for lunch. Wasn't many patrons there. Service was attentive. Food came out fairly quick. I enjoyed the lunch specials and discount pricing. Food quality and taste was decent. I would say above average. Good experience overall

w-cFpKnXktfj3FLjSDuF6w.text: Really good food. The management is really great. The staff is always nice. Very busy location. Get there early!

9EvMC4oKgxrSYN_n7GRoVw.text: I loved the food . Specially you should definitely try the calamari it's great . One of the best Asian food in Arizona . VuwFiK_DOYDf6BBNLrg5Bg.text: 21/2 years in AZ and we have thrown away more Chinese food than we have eaten, I had given up.  But someone took me here, I was of course hesitant. i8ipPRsxCaxz3ryw4HNT5A.text: Service was top shelf, but the kitchen let the hard working wait staff down.   We ordered the lettuce cups, which were solid. Had I known what was to come, I would have stopped right there.  Entrees were Fried Honey Beef and Sizzling Rice Soup, both bordered on inedible. The beef was fried to the point of being devoid of any moisture whatsoever. Effectively beef jerky when it reached the table. The soup should be retitled "wet chicken with stale rice crispies". No flavor at all. I should have known when the sizzling rice didn't sizzle when dropped in.  This place gets lots of good reviews, so maybe I caught them on a bad day, but this meal wasn't even in the ballpark of decent.  2 stars because the waiters really did try hard. The only way they could have provided better service would have been to warn me and the entrees to come and helped me bail out after the appetizer.

VeBHTpTPM6-EV-C1DjimIw.text: Enjoyed Flos for the first time Friday night. Ordered the wonton soup & the chicken wings. We LOVED the wings, so delicious and worth the wait. I also ordered the chicken vindaloo but had it with beef instead, it was a bit too sweet to my liking and not enough spicy. So I took it home and made it a bit more spicy. Overall everything was good.

OMnQ89y1QiqgvJHTVwCcSg.text: I have eaten at the Flo's in North Scottsdale since I was a kid, so when I saw their sign up in Tempe, I got pretty excited. I told my friend we had to come here for happy hour because they have fantastic deals - half off almost all apps and half off all drinks, yes ALL drinks... awesome! I had the mandarin oriental and my friend had the tytini. Her drink was... odd. It wasn't bad, but it didn't taste like anything I have tried before. My drink was very tasty, sweet, but not overly so, and easy to drink. For 4.50, you can't beat it. We also decided to get 3 apps, which have been very delicious at the other location including the pork potstickers, the spicy/limey Lao lettuce wraps, and the spring rolls. The Lao lettuce wraps were as tasty as I remembered... I like how the chicken has a lot of flavor from the chilies, lime, and spices and it's especially good with some potsticker sauce on top. The other two apps were horrible failures. The potstickers up north are typically fried, these were steamed, which isn't a problem except they tasted... off. Like something about them was bad. They were inedible and we left them behind (which is kind of a big deal if you know me because A. potstickers/dumplings are one of my favorite foods and B. I never leave food behind, either it's eaten or boxed). The spring rolls were greasy and flavorless. I hope the lack of deliciousness was due to the restaurant just opening. Regardless, I would return for happy hour drinks if nothing else.

s2__B0fDYZHtF1UQwnHh7A.text: Really poor service. So bad that I can't see us coming back anytime soon. The food just isn't special enough to overcome my bad experience.

AqYN59Wl37m4Y1NCKM0D6A.text: Wow. Now I know what the fuss was about. Service could improve a bit. But food was very good. Would recommend this place anytime.

kpJyspcZOANpMI3MlES8GA.text: This is our new favorite place to eat!  The lemon chicken is the best!  We have excellent service every time we go there.  The price is the lowest we paid in years.  We now are regulars and eat at Flo's at least twice a week!  Thank you to the staff and Kevin who manages a great place!

smZotBsh2KB8fUIZ5WM6oA.text: I'm picky when is comes to Asian food. I used to work at a Japanese restaurant owned by a Japanese chef and I can never find anything that compares until now. BQh2Fh8GWsvXP0tPBvvcAw.text: Well, I came in here to get an order to go .I will start by saying the customer service is fantastic. I placed a to go order, and it was ready so fast. It was still piping hot when I got home which was fantastic!  We got the Chinese Hot and Spicy Soup-Amazing. It had chicken and Shrimp in it. It was large with amble soap, paper towel,and it even smelled nice. I will be visiting this place more often. I just never knew  what I was missing there. I always thought I would stop in there one day. Parking can be busy,since it is in a busy shopping center. It is right next to Whole Foods on Rural.

zCTjdOjt3q6t6aPwBCPwHQ.text: Had a nice late night meal here with family last night. I enjoyed the shrimp Pad Thai, while others in the group had the Lemon Pepper Chicken. 6j2W9W0cRvWE8kGysr6s-w.text: To Upper Management:  Today was our first day experiencing the re-vamped "Happy Hour" menu.   It is disappointing that over the last couple of menu changes, the food options keeping getting restricted or outright eliminated. For example: skewers & calamari are no longer on the menu at the Tempe location.   The Five Spice Shrimp has been removed from the Happy Hour menu and its ironic that it is listed as a "Starter / Appetizer" and this is one of the most expensive items on the entire food menu.   In the last 30 minutes, at least four "regular" customers decided to leave and take their business elsewhere due to these eliminations or the TRIPLING in price from certain cocktail prices.   Not the best marketing move to drive away regulars that are a staple of the restaurant earnings.

GdAn_esV_NSIiLewme8wig.text: I love Flos Tempe location.  I don't love every single dish on the menu, but, there are enough dishes on the menu that I crave, that I go to Flos two or three times a week.  I love the moo goo gai pan, the orange chicken, the honey beef, the mongolian beef and few other of the main dishes.  The lettuce wraps, salt & pepper chicken wings, and spring rolls are great appetizers.  Flos will gladly alter any dish to your liking, like adding mixed vegetables, or putting a different sauce on your dish. At lunch, they serve a complementary salad with fancy greens and a tasty dressing.  This location has a wonderful group of servers, that not only provide excellent food service, but are some of the most friendly and happy servers that I have encountered in the valley.  I am so happy Flos moved into my neighborhood.  Is it perfect...no...no restaurant in the Phoenix metro area is, but I am a pretty fussy eater, and the food and service here keeps me coming back, again and again.

TI_XqAcmMif_e4vLGaX3zw.text: I used to eat at the one in NoSco before having gluten issues. And having seen on the menu several gluten free items, was happy to give the Tempe location a try on a recent visit. I ordered the Lemon Chicken entree. I had water to drink as they didn't serve alcohol and I am not a huge tea or soda drinker. My friend got the wonton appetizers, he enjoyed them. I refrained (the gluten thing). The chicken dish was good but a bit bland, so I asked the server if they had gluten free soy sauce. He went in back and came back several minutes later with some soy sauce in a regular soy sauce container, and said "oh I just put it in a regular container because we don't have any GF containers". My instinct told me not to try it but my tastebuds won out. Within an hour, I was regretting my decision. I was bloated and all the rest of the fun stuff that comes with being "glutened." The next day I contacted the restaurant to give the manager on duty the scoop because I felt that he could use the opportunity to better educate the staff on food restrictions that people face. If a restaurant goes out of their way to state on their menu that certain dishes are gluten free, they need to take that seriously - because people with dietary restrictions have no choice but to take it seriously. Being glutened is no fun. It very well may have been a simple honest mistake or miscommunication between staff so I won't hold it against them. Anyway, I declined the manager's [Devon] very kind offer for a free meal upon a return because that was not the point of my call. Devon took my critique in stride, was very professional and stated he would definitely talk to the staff. I will definitely give them a second chance since the Manager was so understanding.

8wHiDqkAKMnitwmpfP1Elg.text: Had the Tom yum soup and lemon chicken..... The soup was so far from original with a huge bowl and so lemony I had to put water and ice to fix it myself...the huge bowl only had 3 shrimps but had plenty of mushrooms.  The lemon chicken  was enjoyable as well as the service from the bartender.  The place has a calm atmosphere but I will probably try another place and come back once more before I completely forget about it.

tLYfoIS8utxaQwaaaAluIQ.text: The food taste like Pei Wei but Flo's doesn't make you stand in line to order which I appreciate. I must say I was pretty impressed with how efficiently the staff works together to serve the customers and quickly turn over tables.  I had chicken curry and the sauce was delicious, the chicken was tender and the veggies were crisp.  I'll be back for sure!

acXXTBDTLfkZ2EbHUenPmA.text: It disappoints me to give Flo's a 1 star as the food at their Scottsdale location has been decent but I will not return to this one again. After ordering, we were sitting for an over extended period of time for our food. (Ordered carry out). After a while someone brought out a carry out order to the desk but the attendants were not there. Finally the girl walked back to us and said she was going to check on our order. the next thing I see is that she is coming out the other door and walks toward one of her friends working and strikes up a casual conversation completely forgetting about us waiting. I decide to get up to look at the order they brought out and it was ours! Talk about bad service.  So... we get home to eat (ordered the Lemongrass chicken. The dish was completely without flavor and was only a bunch of noodles and some small pieces of chicken. Everything else was left out including the flavor. Charging as much as they do for measly dishes is just plain out ripping people off.  I would never recommend anyone eating here. There is Yupha's Thai and many other delicious places around with much better service staff and quality of food.

The drinks were good and we definitely ordered way too much food, expecting the food portions to be small for HH.  Do not make our mistake, order a couple to start and then order more if you need it - I doubt you will.  Wonderful addition to the neighborhood!

Xa9-NukxM-PJzj-KfIxTmA.text: Great location, above-average food, super happy hour prices, solid service, seriously cold beer, decent bar with plenty of TV's, nice patio at night. What more do you want.? Place is packed each night for a reason. Gets award for: Best Repurposing of a McDonalds.

LUHGLKOx_bSqKoBgbxfeyA.text: I walked in and it was clean. The service was good. We ordered take out. Portion size was good. Food was good. I got the spicy orange chicken which was tasty, the shrimp chow mien, which was awesome and bumbling which were bomb.  I will go again next time I want some Asian fusion

n06ip3bvU7_Q2RJUuXgL_A.text: Sept 2017 edited to add - Unfortunately Flo's menu has had a drastic change. They removed a lot of the options. I was so disappointed to see that the Singapore chicken satay is no longer available. Not sure we'll be back due to the menu change. It's basically Pei Wei now.   Oh wow!  I hope that tonight wasn't a fluke because our first dinner at Flo's was fantastic!  Be sure you take advantage of the happy hour specials, half off appetizers!  We thought about making our entire meal out of appetizers but decided to get one entree as well.   We ordered Chinese lettuce cups, Singapore chicken satay, shu Mai dumplings and black pepper chicken. Everything was delicious!  The portion sizes were generous. My favorites were the Singapore chicken satay and the lettuce cups.  The ingredients were really fresh, the veggies crisp and beautiful...... Couldn't have asked for a better meal.   Lately we've noticed that a lot of the Asian places we have been eating at have overly salty and sometimes goopy sauces. We were so happy to find a place that reminded us that Asian food shouldn't be so salty and sauce heavy. What a nice change!    We definitely could have ordered a couple more appetizers and not ordered the main entree. We will probably go that route next time if we are there for happy hour. I will also order one of the huge bowls of soup that I immediately regretted not ordering when I saw it brought out to a nearby table.  Service was great, restaurant clean and nice environment. We will definitely be going back sooner rather than later. This place is awesome. I might have to go back for the soup this week!

rGSofbwB7-It_7wRsCSQSg.text: First, the service was excellent. My waitress could not have been more attentive or capable. Tried the Hot and Sour soup, Dumplings and Dan Dan noodles. Soup was good, slightly above average. Shu Mai Dumplings were average, I see the same or better at any Dim Sum. The Dan Dan noodles were completely disappointing and I sent them back after 2 bites. CbsDj1Qn4ZKo2FAZ4cL2IA.text: About the service: Came in last Monday at lunch time when it was rather busy. Despite the clear rush they were having since there were only two servers as far as I could tell, they handled it with grace. I was immediately greeted upon walking in the door and given water within a minute of taking my seat. My waitress was going from table to table and making sure everyone was okay right before making it to me. She introduced herself and gave me a genuine smile and answered every question I asked. I believe her name was Amanda. Even gave me a great recommendation, pad Thai. When I got a chance to taste my food, she came back by and asked how it was, and I told her it was good however I wish it had more spice, so she quickly left and came back with two different sauces I could add to make it spicier. Both my water and my tea never ran out. Upon leaving I was also offered a kind smile and was thanked for coming in.   About the food: I had a tea to drink and was offered three choices, I chose passion fruit. It was very good, however it is unsweetened, so you may have to add your own sugar. They start you with a salad and the dressing is amazing. I recommend asking for extra on the side because it is just that good. For lunch I got a pad Thai, and even though it was made with noodles I also got a side of rice. The dish says it is spicy, however it is not at all spicy. It does have a nice flavor to it and is made with wider noodles than a pad Thai typically is.   Overall: very satisfied. Will be back.

R0x7zK6H_3VDbbBT64w1uQ.text: So this is now my second time going to Flo's. I really like hot and sour soup and this place is close to me. I do like the soup but it's $10 dollars because they advertise it as seafood hot and sour but now I'm seeing a pattern. So the last time I got the soup there was two pieces of shrimp in it, and this time there was one. The fact that you up-charge this soup, almost doubling the average cost of Chinese soup by saying it's because it's seafood, is ridiculous!   If you're expecting a normal amount of shrimp in this soup, think again. I will not be ordering this ever again from Flo's.

zvFXja1NATnWUi0EukWCLQ.text: I expected this to be a decent Asian fusion restaurant with some interesting dishes. However, the food quality is just marginally better than fast food and not at all Asian-style cooking, it tastes like sauce out of a bottle poured onto food..not freshly cooked in any style really. I would say it's comparable to Panda Express, maybe the main difference is just that Flo's is a nice, clean, modern restaurant atmosphere. I bet it's a nice place to have drinks in Happy Hour, but I was there today for food. It's also a lot more expensive than the really fantastic Asian restaurants I've tried in the city so far. I go out to eat for the food, and the atmosphere is a bonus. This place is busy, so I guess that a lot of people care more about atmosphere before the food. I tried four entrees, so that's a fair overview of the restaurant.   A few surprising and clueless things about this restaurant:  1) They serve rice along with their noodle dishes (on the same plate)...lol 2) No chopsticks!! 3) Not a single Asian person eating or working in this restaurant...maybe that's a sign in itself.   There are much better Asian restaurants in this city, we were just hungry and stumbled across this one today.

NuSlPcdHpZYFAHEtvEITvw.text: Ok last time I was at Flo's Tempe something seemed off!? But I didn't Really think too much abt it as we had brought our big family there for lunch. Then I went this past Tuesday my cousin, dad and myself went for lunch. It's changed! I totally noticed the lunch selection is way smaller, so are portions too. Ya kno.... it's not the same as it used to be! I bummed Yo! This place is right by my dads house we bring all our relatives there however, I don't think we're going to anymore????

D81S0-gTx0AncB9TEYvc8g.text: Been here alot.  I've said before I come for the food..which is excellent...fresh..and yummy...however I do not go for the service...slow...inattentive..super sweet kids..but there too busy talking together to refill a drink or bring a check...I will continue to come to flos. I have realistic expectations about service

BJNyamnabr66_RFLg1xoXg.text: Best Japanese food since we where in Tokyo.  Fantastic crab rangoons and very good curry. We where very surprised to find Japanese curry this good.

YW3d04_IsPWGfjTNvhYyzA.text: I like the chicken lettuce wraps here. They are delicious and you just can't stop with one. It's a nice place to enjoy some fusion food.

hoE1shiEVHhaHIN2zVozTQ.text: I started going to Flo's years ago off Raintree and have been to the other location off FLW for lunch as it's near my office.  This was our first time trying this location off baseline.    I noticed the menu had changed and unfortunately it also lead to an experience that was very different than I was used to.  I'm not sure if it is under new management or it was just an off night, but I have definitely had better at the other locations.   The pot stickers came out undercooked.  the top was still very dough-like.  the chicken was extremely sweet and the beef was just ok.     I'm not sure I will visit this location again, but I will still hit-up flo's off FLW and Scottsdale.

-eqxspQjwXSXinZomweyEw.text: My husband and I were in the plaza for another reason. We had to wait for the other reason and we were hungry so we stopped in for lunch. My husband ordered the spicy ginger and onion beef and I ordered the twice cooked pork. The decor was upscale. The service was prompt and pleasant. The food was very good. Great lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Flo's - New Asian Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States. Spicy ginger and onion beef luncheon
Photo of Flo's - New Asian Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States. Twice cooked pork luncheon

06cp0V93woGi7bdtSk9ztQ.text: There Have Been Some Changes At Flo's Recently. Happy Hour Now Much More Limited In Beverage Selection And Food Items. No Longer 50%Off All Drinks Now Only Select Beers And Wines And *Specially Priced. Still 7 Days @ Week But For Me Disappointed In Change After What 20 Years. Still Decent Offerings But Less Motivated To Visit Seeing That HH Can Now Cost $30 For 2 Lettuce Cups Still Same Size But Now They Charge For Chips They Serve With Soup. Hot _ Sour Soup Very Good.  House Wine Was A Brand X Okay But Not Great. Probably Elect Too Opt Out or Something Like Beer Would Be Ok.  So Just Sharing Update***

uZzHexOAVZ9sF3ept9rc5w.text: I've been to Flo's a couple of times for lunch and it is consistently good. I think that the lunch menu is a good deal. I really enjoy their green curry. My cousin tells me the yellow curry is also very good. I also find the service to be efficient and friendly. This is a great option for dining in the Tempe area.

VZPJQLJlIdKfG5qy5TI_mA.text: This was my first time at Flo's and to say that it was an amazing experience is an understatement.  Not only was our server, Jennifer, incredible, but the food was pure perfection.  The bussers, hosts, and the bartenders work in perfect harmony allowing for no wait times for food or drinks.  My husband and I cannot wait to return!  P.s.  Happy Hour is amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Flo's - New Asian Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States

g74-6QN0dFpMGJUziYu-Pw.text: I really liked our luncheon at Flo's!  It's easy for a big table to get out of hand but at Flo's they just make big tables look easy. Service was spot on. The did put full water pitchers on the table and that annoys me but I never picked up a pitcher and my glass stayed full.  The food was remarkably delicious, I had The shrimp with asparagus and I thought it was excellent. everyone seemed to love the meals served.   Prices are fair and its a great looking place. Flo's is on my radar for a return visit.

yXiRpB6j00xoPIKU4QtWAw.text: I gave it 4/5 stars because the food for lunch is worth it at $7.95 a plate. You can't beat that price. It tastes fresh and delicious. However, I couldn't give it 5/5 stars because I have some beef with Flo's. They got rid of my favorite dish from their menu about a year ago and that was the only reason I went there. It was a curried beef with cashews. I've been salty about the fact that they took it off the menu ever since but I will admit, when I went back the other day it was pretty good. Our waiter was very friendly and everyone was super attentive to our needs (water, clearing plates, etc)

FyGZpcxWcLo2pgKNqMDOpQ.text: Very generic "asian" food; those looking for authentic dishes should go elsewhere. We tried two happy hour appetizers, the dumplings were the good but the bbq pork was overly soft and warm rather than hot. This was disappointing as it was clearly not made fresh. We ordered two entrees as well, the chicken teriyaki over rice and chicken katsu. The katsu was decent considering it wasn't even called that, it was listed under a bland english name. Points for how thin and crisp it was; however, no katsu sauce? no Japanese condiments at all? No deal. The teriyaki bowl was monotone in flavor and texture; if we could get something crunchy/crispy up in there and add some veggies it could be 80X better. Worst part was bill was $40 for two people; I could eat so well at Chanpen Thai for that.. and not feel like I'm paying dumb money for white asian food sns (I gotta say tho, the full bar is beautiful)

photos.caption: Photo of Flo's - New Asian Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States. chicken teriyaki and katsu
Photo of Flo's - New Asian Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States. chicken teriyaki bowl
Photo of Flo's - New Asian Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States. full bar is beautiful

9PdEq0kRQwq69ZbxICnIMg.text: So I've been told on multiple occasions I've been told to try this place. Me and my partner went on a Saturday and we loved the food and deals. Got seated instantly. The lunch special was perfect and then the food was the best. I got that pho and my goodness. It was a huge bowl and I had to take it home. I recommend that for sure. I would say Saturday is the best day to come because of that deal!

QE4TxKXqMURVECkhpTl5JQ.text: First time trying this location and I was pretty impressed! The staff was really friendly and the space was clean and spacious. The food was not as tasty to me as the Scottsdale location, but it was still good. I also asked our server for extra wonton chips with our lunch and she brought us out a whole plate with a dipping sauce as well. The food came out quickly and we were satisfied with our meal. Will be back to try more of their options.

photos.caption: Photo of Flo's - New Asian Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chicken Katsu (Lunch Portion)

ywJdMpvMvt3JkrjEJVwNiA.text: Love Flos...I do not understand why this place has anything less than 5 stars. My husband and I come here all the time. The service is great, the food is great, the location is great. Their chicken fried rice is amazing!!

_yeKlEl0zCYyJ3wdPDJ-cA.text: While having a few valley locations, I have to admit that I always feel like this place is local eatery. I'm not a big fan of the chain places however this location has made the list of "family go to spots" as they have something that accommodates our family's wide variety of taste.  Flo's sits near the intersection of Rural & Baseline. Lot's of options in the area so it's busy with wandering drivers. We did a pickup previously during the eventing and parking was challenging, but realized they didn't have a designated Takeout Parks up front.   Comfortable atmosphere with a full bar along with multiple televisions just in case you want to check out a game. We ordered the seafood noodle soup, several potstickers which by the way I enjoy the fact that they make chicken potstickers and not just pork.  We also picked up some orange chicken and peking duck and quite a few cocktails to help with the edge of the holidays.  It wasn't a pack night but it was great to have our server and staff very attentive throughout the course of our meal.  All of the food was solidly good and honestly came out tasting as  expected.

photos.caption: Photo of Flo's - New Asian Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States. Mandarin Oriental cocktail.. good but pricey $10
Photo of Flo's - New Asian Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States

JpSsD8Q2neB_2TCWbVXusA.text: The best happy hour! Not just for drinks but food! We got so many drinks and 5 food plates! All happy hour items! Needless to say I'll be back there again!

c86XoIHK-p9uO6MruAopyQ.text: I really had high hopes for this place because it had good reviews but this food was completely bland and tasteless.  As an appetizer I had the spicy wontons which were not spicy at all but had more flavor than anything else I ate. Service was good.  It was a bit pricey and no flavor.  I won't be back.

jD_ZFsEQ7v9fisfaCQeeZg.text: Typical fusion Asian food.  Nothing special.  Spicy foods are mild at most.  If you're tired of pei wei maybe give this place a shot?

OxVFvOIWe4uC1FikPEFE8Q.text: Welcome to Tempe.  Happy hour is 3-7 with 1/2 price apps & alcohol drinks.  Place was busy but service was still great.  We ordered from the appetizer menu Thai calamari, Thai shrimp skewers, Chinese lettuce wraps & Crispy spring rolls.  Quick service, water glasses filled & yummy food.  We will come back soon.  If you need gluten free they have lots to choose from.

r1c49hI7CivEIjOFPS3d6w.text: Was looking for a place for Asian cuisine. My sister recommend Flo's as she raved about it!  I ordered the Cantonese Style Pork and was disappointed as the dish really had no flavor and was bland.  My sister ordered the eggplant with garlic sauce which was amazing!  As for a food rating I would give 3 stars.  As for overall experience and wait staff rating I would give a 2.  The staff was definitely attentive, however, when bringing a stack of 6  dishes to the table for our party to use, instead of using 2 hands which would have been a better choice, the waiter chose to use 1 hand and placed the stack of dishes on the table with his 1 hand wrapped around the plates and his thumb smack in the middle of the top plate.  First off, probably a health violation, not certain, but definitely would think twice about eating there again.  Second you would think someone who was waiting on tables for a living would know better.  The next thing was twice we were brought a dirty dish and utensils that were not entirely clean.   Really wish I had a better experience as I was looking forward to trying a new place.

6hYYpdXlI2CAyr6kyA_y3g.text: FLO'S IS THE S#*%!  I've only been here twice coming from Omaha, NE visiting family, but it's been amazing both times. Highly recommend happy hour 1/2 price drinks and App's 3-7 - the lettuce cups and salt and pepper (vegetable pepper) wings are amazing. Stephanie has been amazing both times!

kD5BqttHjyICqbs2VlUdRg.text: This is one of my family's favorite places to go for Chinese! The food is fresh and delicious! There are also a few veggie options which is great for me! The flavored are good and the staff is great!

iSa2Itw8-tfZdZ4id4LubQ.text: Since this location is brand new, it wasn't yet on Yelp. I requested for an additional menu to gather information and add the business onto Yelp. I informed our server it was strictly for Yelp adding purposes and that I wasn't going to order anything else. He informed the manager and they sent us a free dessert for helping aid their start to social media. Great management team!! Thanks Flo's!

VIIltVfo1TFEBcGug5fqrg.text: The greatest unknown place in Tempe. Amazing happy hour specials - which helped contribute to me becoming a regular here. They have tasty takes on Chinese cuisine and the ambience inside or outside feels right. If I had a magic wand, I'd probably spice up the servers to be a little more proactive and perhaps even transition into a sophisticated lounge atmosphere for evenings.

CF7LuAJbGjvODF5GNLqIag.text: Love this place! Super flavorful and reasonable. We normally do take out. A must try...

u_I8FAPHCRRjQZz7q2DCUQ.text: Very good. .. glad to see / eat  fresh hot food. Very polite and well kept. I will be back

photos.caption: Photo of Flo's - New Asian Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States

1s0XVLcxOt4fOycKxY4RWA.text: I enjoyed this meal. Having ordered the Beef & Wide Noodles, I was glad to see the healthy-sized bowl presented to me. They bury the noodles way down there, but there are plenty. The food is heavily-oiled, but not overly salted.   Fun and entertaining music played at this location. Bright atmosphere; lovin' the windows and the decor. Stylish, clean, with small tables and lots of dining space.

kL_Q7sb8umsyplgmmStpYA.text: Awesome happy hour with great prices and delicious food but be prepared for loud indoor dining with 'can't be bothered' wait staff. The silver lining is that we were served by Stephanie. Because of her we go back.

1-tr16-4Ey8c87kgLns2vA.text: Food was priced right.  It was real loud inside and hard to hear from across the table. Waiter was nice and helpful. My only other comment would be that they wait by your table to take your dish whether you were done eating or not. That irritated me tremendously.

photos.caption: Photo of Flo's - New Asian Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States. Flo&#39;s outside

txxG895ICRgVEm1rQPOfFA.text: My fiance & I were in Tempe last week to see our beloved Cubbies play 2 preseason games and happened to stumble upon this awesome restaurant for dinner.  We were blown away by the incredible variety of selections (even for me who is GF), excellent service,but most of all the fresh & delicious entrees (huge portions)at very reasonable prices! Definitely try their huge bowls of tasty soup meant for sharing! We only wish there was a Flo's back in the Chicagoland area!

sq18Skbd7XsoEJc2hwRcXw.text: Ordered food2go got home was very low quality and wasn't happy about my meal for the price

Iq6DNYD2HIj5qlyq-N5jOA.text: This was the best Chinese food I have eaten in years!  The Moo-shoo chicken was excellent!  Apps were great also. Our sever was very accommodating to have noddles instead of rice on the kids meal.  Overall 5+ Stars!

1lULEDy6AbGjQV4E8b54Iw.text: Food was great, but I was disappointed with their customer service. When ordering a plate that came with a side of white rice, I asked them if they could substitute the white rice with fried rice and I offered to pay them extra to do so. They said that there was no way that they would be able to do that even after I insisted that I'd pay them a good amount just so that I could have fried rice... just seems like a simple request from a customer that would do the restaurant no harm, especially when the customer is willing to pay for the substitution...

Wg45tviqKiIfRUcQu4NRtQ.text: What a great place for happy hour! We sat at the bar food and service was great and such a good price!

KYoNZaIJHJzCyYbhpg4YrQ.text: Happy to have a good Asian place in the neighborhood! I cannot believe this used to be McDonald's. They did a really amazing job making the place over. For a former fast food joint stuck with another ol' strip mall they managed to make this place feel inviting yet open and airy.  Okay, on to the food. My boyfriend and I started out our meal with the regular lettuce wraps. They were really good. I could have just eaten these as my meal. We would have liked a little more sauce for them though - mostly because the sauce added so much flavor to it.   For our entrees I went with a chicken and veggies dish - it was a slight variation on the chicken and veggie stir fry and my boyfriend got sweet & sour chicken. The portions were huge - we definitely could have shared. And I liked that they gave us both white and brown rice - perfect for a little mix and match. The ingredients tasted fresh and the dishes were very flavorful. Overall we really enjoyed our meal. And then we enjoyed it the next day as leftovers, too.   We'll definitely be back.

MU5cejejW2LHg0w2RKHxxQ.text: Good stuff...been to the one Scottsdale several times and always enjoyed...glad they brought one to the SE valley. For apps, we orders the spring rolls and the pork dumplings.  The I'm in love with the egg rolls at PF Changs and these don't really measure up...sorry! The dumplings were amazing.  They are steamed and we had them done a bit crispy.  They were a perfect combination of steamed and lightly pan friend!  Amazing!! We went with the classic Cashew Chicken and the kids Sweet & Sour Chicken.  Both were great.  I love this place!  We passed on desert so no review there.

TAiGAUzmqmzWrl7-qHaifw.text: my go to Chinese food place!!! so fresh and good prices too! the staff are always friendly and professional! in my opinion its the best chinese food in tempe!!

DnOMv5CSBPNWO_ChVwKo2A.text: Took a date and had decided to sit on the porch. The inside seemed a little too loud for us, and the porch is very pleasant with a high fence and outdoor heaters to keep us comfortable.   I had the green curry and will order it again. She had orange chicken and seemed to enjoy it. We also shared crab rangoon and they were fine, nothing crazy, but still good.   The hostess was very pleasant and our waiter was a gentleman. We enjoyed our night and have talked about revisiting.

mflJmM6MYEMHw-VNrRzuTA.text: Flo's Asian has finally made it to Tempe! We have been fans of "Flo's of Scottsdale" since she opened her 1st restaurant in Scottsdale! So it's great they're open now in the heart of Tempe, at Baseline & Rural Rd. Great Interior Design...such a nice, bright open feel! We had excellent service and the food did not disappoint!  We started off with  1/2 price appetizers, Crab Puffs & Spicy Wontons.  (Happy Hr. is every day from 3-7pm with 1/2 price DRINKS also!)  For the main course, I got the Cashew Chicken and my partner got the Kung Pao Chicken. All were as delicious as we remembered! At the end of our dinner, Flo herself came out to the table to check on us & thank us and wished me a Happy Birthday! We topped off the delicious meal with complimentary "scrumptious" Chocolate Won tons!  We'll be back for sure! Way to go Flo!

photos.caption: Photo of Flo's - New Asian Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States. building at Rural &amp; Baseline Rd. next to WHOLE FOODS
Photo of Flo's - New Asian Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States. Delicious Entreés
Photo of Flo's - New Asian Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States. Beautiful light &amp; bright interior!

U6DEAQmmMzmD5a6RkJwd3A.text: Arrived for dinner with minimal wait time. First impression very noisy. Wait staff very attentive. But lack luster food. Pool of grease came under the spring rolls and the entree was very dry.

wB8ouqDfVIAeqSq9bgkgVA.text: The food was amateur at most, A+ to service though. The food wasnt that great for the price, but edible. Go to P.F. Changs instead.

FWNMy7wbotBW9KgUodQO-w.text: Great HH specials! The 7 of us ordered delicious cocktails and Tiger/Tsingtao beer...  Everyone enjoyed the lettuce wraps (chicken and tofu), wings (takes ~20min), crab puffs, Mongolian beef and spring rolls. Everything was tasty! It is newer so a slight wait on our server as it got more busy for HH and dinner. It is a cute place and cannot wait to use the patio when it gets cooler. Expect us to go there again!

NX3B0tFjTyUGODjBwz7aPA.text: Food was hot and good. Prices were reasonable and the service was excellent.  The lemon chicken and pepper chicken with a Hugh bowl of egg drop soup.

X83MTb8KpuvPs-btwKEGBQ.text: I have been here several times for lunch to explore the fusion style menu. I'm a big fan of wasabi mashed potatoes and this place does some good one's.   The service has the feel of a college town diner, good & polite, but don't expect them to  anticipate or suggest your next pairing of Shoyu glazed pork.   They could work on the selection of sorbets, as this was lacking.   I'm sure the dinner menu is most likely more enhanced than the lunch offerings.

GmbL2F_BJ6T-gS53BFzlUQ.text: We have eaten here probably 3 or 4 times now, simply for the fact that it's nearby and easy to get, but we must say the food quality here is pretty low, the flavors are very hit or miss (mostly miss), and the prices they're charging for this mediocre food are way too high. We would expect to pay half as much for food this poor. We just spent $40 on a to go order for lunch and not only did they mess up our order (we think the waitress was new, she didn't know the answers to any questions on the phone), but about 3/4 of our food was nearly inedible... it was just plain gross. Just a waste, we threw it out after a few bites. Suffice to say, I don't think we'll come back again.

XK8FXn2H9TA04XSWivgQog.text: Food is always great but the service was terrible.!!!  The hostess was very rude and we had to ask 3 people to get a waiter to take our order.

_k_nH1owgT0lnzldMQxC6w.text: Delicious food! I've tried many Asian style restaurants and this is by far one of the best. Service was outstanding and food was phenomenal. I will definitely be back.

T0I6Fw0EhjPu0YfgCB5GXA.text: Flo's has great food and great service.  Plus they are right across the street from Doc and Eddy's Bar.

ReHQWEmDRgTP_EL8oGmNhQ.text: The customer service here was beyond amazing. I never ordered food from here and the gentleman at the desk explained everything and was so kind!

o19zKSFgrf9nTxTMQcZkvA.text: Let me be clear...the service at Flo's is wonderful. I ordered the Edamame, Spring Rolls and Won Ton Soup.  The Edamame was cooked well, but was just salted and needed garlic or something. The Spring Rolls were just ground chicken with really no vegetables or too little to make out. The texture of just ground style meat was not appetizing. The Won Ton was a huge portion and had large won tons with a whole shrimp which was nice, but they were too big for your mouth and too hard to chase in the broth to cut. I tried to just bite one on the spoon, but it was difficult. The iced tea was excellent!  I REALLY wanted to love the food since the staff was so wonderful, but it just wasn't what I expected.

FyRBTzmiB6hG07wWE4LZDA.text: I met my buddy MT here for lunch. He suggested it and I'm glad he did. I like this place, a lot. First, it's beautiful. Well, if modern colors and lines with a contemporary feel is beautiful to you, this is the place. I liked it the minute we walked in the door. We were greeted immediately and taken to our table. Our server, Blaze, was soon at our table taking our drink orders. $2.50 for ice tea is spot on. Very good green tea I would like to say. MT ordered the Shu Mai ($6) to start. Lovely little steamed pork dumpling. Full of tasty puree'd pork with a ramekin of sweet & spicy dipping sauce. A tad salty but overall this was a great start to our lunch. MT ordered the House Pan Fried Noodles ($9). He said his lunch was good. I was impressed that our entree's came with a small house salad. Nothing special but for the price this little add on was perfect. I ordered the Lo Mein ($8.50) subbing in Thin Rice Noodles with a mix of Vegetables and Roasted Pork. The noodles were delish, the veggies were a combo of steamed broccoli, zuchinni, bean sprouts and napa cabbage. The pork was long strips, seasoned fine but a tad overcooked. In addition was a half baseball size pile of brown rice. All in all a very good dish. Lots of Gluten Free items on the menu as well as Spicy and/or Vegetarian choices. Happy days. Great Service, really good food, fair prices (lunch), beautiful space. 4 Stars

photos.caption: Photo of Flo's - New Asian Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States. Rice Noodles

2ubdyGpOsH_zn6pU3sZuLw.text: I was so excited when I found out there is a Flo's in Tempe.  I was a frequent visitor of the Scottsdale locations throughout high school.   Half off drinks and appetizer's for happy hour, you can't get better than that!  Their crab puffs are still some of the best around.

oJ572WLoVVmE6dcdP5I8Pw.text: When my sweetheart's mother suggested an Asian restaurant called Flo's, he just about hung up on her.  Luckily for us, she stuck to her guns.  We absolutely loved Flo's!  In fact, we went there twice in December!  We tried several dishes, but our favorites so far have been the fried calamari (which has delicious peppers mixed in), the lettuce cups (which have a great kick to them), the egg fried rice with chicken (I rarely like fried rice at restaurant's - this was fabulous) and the pho was pretty good, too!  The pad Thai was really good at a level 5 once I added a ton more red chili paste. I just like it better elsewhere.   They have an amazing happy hour from 3 to 7 daily, which gets you 50% off appetizers and drinks!  I love a good deal. This one will have me coming back time and again.   It is really a cute restaurant, too!  Now you know what to get me as a gift... A Flo's giftcard!

rM8BIA9-B2RFIlZOrF4EXg.text: Got the Panang curry, Thai basil chicken, and the chocolate won tons for dessert. So good! I'm a curry critic (love my green and panang) and I liked this one. Would go again and love that it close to my house. Nice ambiance as well.

liZWbOqx2R-Rv94-w-cP2A.text: DON'T COME HERE IF YOU WANT REAL, AUTHENTIC ASIAN FOOD!  This place is full of people who use forks. We should have walked out right when we stepped in and realized that there were no Asian diners. Just a panda express disguised as fancier dine in. Chicken was dry and costs over ten bucks, our "calamari" was a joke as well. A couple of the employees were slacking, it was awkward seeing a couple of them flirt and not pay attention to their tables. They obviously don't care about looking and acting professional. Go to panda express and save your money and your taste buds if you want fake Chinese. Also, it's not exactly the fact that it was so far from authentic, because I like and tolerate fake Asian food just as much as the next college student, but this was just overpriced shit. It was one of those rare bad food experiences where you regret even walking in. There is absolutely nothing worse than paying for a horrible meal.

wKRutGQoLZUCvK9MV4aVBA.text: My girlfriend and I went to dinner here and her meal came out with the wrong type of noodles so they went ahead and remade the dish for her. Then our waitress informed us that the manager and her went ahead and comped our WHOLE $34 meal (2 entrees and an appetizer) for us because of the kitchen's mistake. Good food and great customer service!! We'll be back!

wr9aujJ2gwUaR_IHLwFtXQ.text: Food was amazing!!!!  Best fried chicken my husband has had,  ever!  His words,  not mine.   Service was superb!!!  Manager was walking around making sure everyone's food was to their liking,  including us of course.   My son is a very picky eater and he loved the orange chicken,  without the green stuff Lol!  Highly recommended:)

iYt99T1Un0SPE8KqBp68Lw.text: Flo's has the most delicious food and absolute great service. Their lunch specials are fantastic and prices are great, I come here for lunch periodically through the week and on the weekend for dinner and i have not once been disappointed with service or food quality. I highly recommend.

tAoM0HzCKl6h_nObnohcBA.text: This was our first time back in a couple years to see if the food had improved at all. Unfortunately, it hadn't. Filling for the lettuce cups was greasy and flavorless. Stir-fried vegetables were boringly bland. And the black tea was thin and appeared to have been brewed long ago. But the service was good. Maybe we'll try again in 2019. Not.

JcXL5uB03r59zKYlCv5Vnw.text: Bad ambience. The food was a disaster. Wonton soup was water and uncooked wontons. Red curry came without the rice. The only food I enjoyed was the lettuce wraps.  Never again.

vP2PM1vFiwE5h1w0nlvVsA.text: This place was recommended to me by a good friend who said this was the best place to go too for Asian/Chinese food. The atmosphere is nice. I like the way it is decorated but I will say that for the prices, I wish the seating was a tad more intimate. It had more of a fast food seating arrangement. It is very clean and nice though. For appetizers, we ordered the crab puffs and the salt & pepper wings. Fyi, the wings take a minimum of 20 mins, our main entree came out first. For our main dish, we ordered the crispy honey beef. This was by far AAAAHMAZING. Awesome flavor. Also got an order of bbq pork fried rice. The rice was just okay. The pork needed more flavor. We also ordered a drink and beer. Before tip, our total was about $69.  For what we ordered, I don't think it was worth that price but it won't keep us from eating there again. Also, it would have been nice to have our food boxed up instead of ourselves having to do it....I would recommend this to others.

2VGDkt6Kd1zqpuqqEtV2Dw.text: Great gem in Tempe. The food is flavorful and plentiful. Service is great and the servers are well trained.  Don't order too much. Lots of plates are big enough to share. And if you do get too much, it is yummier the next day.  Get there for Happy Hour. Great drinks and appetizers.

9uR3RcmZpdjy05YzPo34rg.text: Happy Hour everyday is awesome (half off most apps and drinks!). Entrees are ok, last few orders vegetable to meat ratio was a little high (I like more meat!). Can get expensive if eating outside of happy hour hours.

GEJlTREMaPllbF5r4aLudw.text: Have been told good things about the Scottsdale location. Went in for a late lunch with a friend. Menu selection was awesome and it was during happy hour so it made it even better.  Food was excellent, and the serving sizes were large enough the meal could have been split in two.  The only downside to this visit was the fact they only seemed to have one server on duty. It took her awhile to get our order in and to bring drinks. Could have simply been shift change, not sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Flo's - New Asian Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States

0XhS8O3pG0s7Gbd0DsuKNA.text: I used to love Flos. Someone should write to them directly about their price increase. So sad. They have good food & reasonable prices. Funny, the food doesn't taste as good as it once did.

w7ik0RwbiNCBbz9c2vyaCw.text: Order the Duck, takes 24 hours! Worth it... Everything else and I have had all the apps and a large portion of the menu is alright. Also the layout is kinda wonky and awkward.

ktgC10QLxLz4efurs6HIEw.text: The food and service was pretty good.  The building  use to be a McDonalds years ago but Flo's has remodeled it so well you could never tell.  If i am in the area I would eat here again but otherwise I  wouldn't go outta my way to drive to Flo's when there are so many other options.

-4GDm7JMKS_spkKxdHZzoA.text: Great happy hour with half price drinks. Interesting and unique drink menu. Awesome Bloody Mary. Nice little wonton chips for free at the bar. Salt and pepper chicken wings take a little while but are worth the wait. Will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Flo's - New Asian Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of Flo's - New Asian Cuisine - Tempe, AZ, United States

-JzycB017uIGqCSmT_PYNg.text: I really like this place but they definitely have some things to work on. I would give this place 3.5 stars if I could.   Pros: food is great, service is good, drinks are strong, restaurant looks nice.  Cons: if you come during dinner time it is extremely loud. They did an extremely poor job with sound management. It would also be nice if they put some booths in as the seating isn't the most comfortable. Also seems like they might be understaffed, though I myself am surprised a restaurant is this busy on a Wednesday evening!   I think this place has a lot of potential. They do a very interesting mix of Asian foods including Chinese, Indian, Thai, etc. I really hope they can work out their kinks. Especially the sound.. It wasn't fun to sit here in silence with my fiance.

RXxfC5vTboez5NuO3vuaCQ.text: We were recommended to go to this place because it was good we are in the area and we looked at yelp we were close. Would recommend what were the favorite and it was absolutely Wonderful. This past week for sure will be coming back soon. They also said happy hour from 3-7 everyday.

g4NsvirKE1e9ljogzSSsfg.text: A group of us came here for dinner and I was not a big fan! The portion sizes were small and the price we paid was big. The food wasn't tasty at all. I think Pei Wei's food is a lot flavorful and the food portions are better. We spent close to $80.00 for dinner for five. The service was very good because the restaurant was empty during dinner.

r37Q7tqNa_YGqOerkHpCHA.text: All the food is good, spicy lettuce wraps are so great!! And the happy hour from 3-7 is truly a great deal. Love Flo's

Kb6OHtfjpELnTCbps71IKg.text: Went with my wife who told me how great it was when she went with her girlfriends earlier in the week. The place is nice and clean. The waiter was nice but we asked for the appetizers to come first and then our food. Well the appetizers took at least 15 minutes to come and one of them was wrong. Then the main dishes came out like one minute later so no time to enjoy. The waiter apologized and also said sorry about the wrong dish but never took it off the bill. The food was pretty bland which is another reason for 3 stars.  The portions were good sized but a little pricey. The east valley has some really authentic Asian places that I would rather go to

DZUUlYtPPu1oxWr8OIJT5w.text: I recently had lunch here with a friend who recommended it. The restaurant is modern, which to some may seem a bit sterile. I thought it was a pleasant atmosphere, very clean, with the tables spaced so that you were not on top of the diners next to you. I chose Teriyaki Chicken, and fortunately inquired whether it included any vegetables. The waiter said it did not, but offered to have fresh steamed vegetables added for a small fee. The waiter was very attentive, constantly refilling our water glasses, etc. Our entrees arrived fairly quickly and were delicious. The added vegetables were prepared perfectly. The portions were generous and I took home half of mine for dinner. I would definitely return to Flo's and would recommend it to friends.

IQvik-y8krXzReYeAUgFmQ.text: Was in Phoenix on travel, this place was suggested for happy hour.  Well the server didn't know the specials.  Then when we ordered some other person dropped food off at the table with an attitude.  Server had to be flagged down to get assistance.  We called the manager over to tell him about the service.  Glad I don't live there and wont go back if i did.  Maybe service is better at the bar than table service.

J3d_xjmGTOi7UuPycJfJjg.text: I have never had such service that I had to let others know about it.Yesterday was Valentine's Day and so we decided we were going to order take out and have a family night. We choose Flo's  in Tempe because an individual recommend it said he goes there for lunch all the time and  said it's fantastic. I wish I could have received the same service he gets at lunch time. So I call to order take out and the young lady answers and asks if she could put me on a brief hold sure I said knowing it's a busy day of the year so it was a little bit of time that I held probably 3 minutes or so and she comes on I tell her I would like to order take out coconut soup,pot stickers, wings,crab puffs and pepper bacon shrimp she kept correcting me chicken bacon I'm  like no my husband seen it on your menu then she finds it tells me the keys on system are always moving ok whatever 58.00 I seen on the website 50% off most appetizers and drinks ( doesn't say in house) you should probably put which ones are so people can see them. But was in shock I thanked her and hung up  omg I was thinking I text my husband to tell him how much  because he was on his way. He asks WTH did you order I'm thinking regular Chinese food appetizers  and though one might at least be half off. then I called back I asked the woman to remove coconut soup and she  very abruptly say I will and hangs up the phone(rude) so my husband proceeds to get home we sit down to eat and I was shocked this food was like nothing we expected at all the only thing half decent was the crab puffs because they weren't soggy and for 7.50 and only 6 in the bag the wings had a good flavor very scary looking because they put crispy wings on a plastic container that's not a good move and that was 12.95  wasn't a dozen  which I was shocked for that price and ordered the pot stickers they were gummy as if they were not cooked fully and they were pork so didn't want to take a chance getting food poison, my poor husband after working all day gets a container of soggy bacon what looked like Roma tomatoes soggy and it had 4 shrimp in it. Our Valentine's Day was to focus on each other and express the love we have for each other  instead we didn't eat much of this very over priced meal. To top it all off in conversation about how mad at ourselves we were for getting food from there. My husband says you didn't get your coconut soup I said I know I called and cancelled he said they still charged me for it I called and explained to them what happened there was not a sympathetic answer given basically it was 20 questions I was asked was it a man or woman that checked you out? Do you happen to know their name? My favorite one was are you sure you didn't get it? Then she puts me on hold and a man picks up ( please let your customers know that they will be transferred) I said do you know why I'm calling ?he said yes and then told me what I can do is give you store credit we have a book here with the names in it ( I had to chuckle because I understood after what I was served I understood why)or I can void your transaction and I'll need to take your credit card over the phone with the 8.50 plus tax taken off . We chose the void. He says I do see a 10.00 tip should we keep or remove that no keep it I stated it's Valentine's Day so he then tells me what my total is charges the cards I still have not received a sympathetic response even from the manager. I will never eat nor recommend this place and I will be telling my close friend that frequents there today when I get to work. I have been in the service industry for years my recommendations  are: 1. You should never make any customer feel like your to busy to assist or take care of them and not a good idea to the game clue when a customer said they didn't receive something. 2. You should probably reevaluate the container you use for hot food because as cost effective as they may be that alone will loose you business nobody should be subjected to pay high prices for soggy food 3. You should put quantities on your menu so people know what they are getting for that price 4.If the roles where changed I may have "apologized" for the level of service along with asked how everything else was and more then likely being it was one of the busiest days of the year would have at least gave 50% off the meal to encourage return business . 5. Know what goes out of your restaurant should always be known for quality not quantity. I would never tell no one to eat at flo's because that is just not me but I wanted to share my service with you as a first time guest. Thank you

pW3L6HtKAxXRuT2RAzPdXg.text: The food was very delicious and service was excellent. We were a party of ten people and everyone commented on the extensive menu and how pleased they were with the food and drinks. We'll be coming back often. Flo's is very busy around the six o'clock hour, recommend making reservations.

bltVhsM9t3KVob1Tqyj2qw.text: Took a while to finally get seated and the waitstaff acted as if it wasn't their job to seat us. When the waitstaff finally paid attention to us, we were seated, but the service was pathetic. The need for drink refills went unnoticed and it took 30 minutes to get the check. After leaving the restaurant, neither of us felt great from the food and decided the leftovers needed to be trashed. I had such high hopes for this restaurant, but I'll never be back.

SqwxLHjEWTqnJf5Yajc0WA.text: We've been to Flo's in Tempe several times. Unfortunately, the food is not consistent. Last night we did take out; the order was incorrect - included a pork dish & we don't eat meat. They did correct the Oder but by then the vegi egg rolls were ice cold. The "experience" was ruined & most of it is ready for Fri trash day. Expansion without quality control just simply isn't worth it.

fyZsvbZhpEV5MFlxc82XlQ.text: I took my parents this this restaurant yesterday. We had been there twice before and found it good so we thought we would go back for a third time. That will be the last time. What could go wrong, actually did.  We were later than usual and was surprised how conversations and general noise carried in this place. We could not hear each other without raising our voices, also asking the speaking person to repeat what they had just said. Very uncomfortable. We ordered one of the lettuce wraps for an appetizer and could not eat them because of the high spice content that I did not see on the menu when I ordered them. That was a waste of money.  We ordered brown rice and ended up with white. Of course it was taken care of when we brought it to the server's attention but come on... Another server attempted to deliver an order to our table that was not ours and we had a hard time convincing her that it was not ours. The gentleman that was responsible for re-setting the tables was walking by and we all noticed that he was holding the clean water glasses in place as he walked with his chin inside the open part of the top glass. Ugh! Let's just say, we didn't drink any more water after we saw that! The server could not remember our order from our table to the ordering station and had to keep coming back for clarification. Service was slow and it took us forever to get our bill and then to have the opportunity to pay it. The actual main dishes were not as good as we had before and we had to once again chase with server down for dinner plates. All we had were the serving platters. Needless to say, the leftovers did not come home with us since they were not up to par the first time around. We were not impressed.

5ckUFVRl3rkX1CTNpjRl3w.text: I just ate at Flo's and the service was amazing! The food was delicious and the ambiance was really nice.

YcI6xV_MOTg5GUO7706_VA.text: I think this place put MSG on their food. After dining in last Saturday I got severely dehydrated and was experiencing headache and shortness of breath.

VGFxEbcjZgEKNQGODvs3Ug.text: Food was delicious, service was more of a community effort.  We had an issue with the food, more of a personal preference, and it was resolved quickly.  Would have liked more attention from our designated server. Will eat here again.  The business should close up the south end of the patio to hide/quiet the Baseline road noise and lights coming into the parking lot.

qFv-wkEiLhfH_cC4OfX0ew.text: Food is alright. Ambiance is boring. Service is always great though! Good happy hour menu. I do like that they have a bar area with a couple of tv's. I just wish they had better food options (like sushi) and a better ambiance.

oHPaAMrrpr_sfRj4bnx_AA.text: Ok...so who goes to happy hour at a Chinese restaurant? This guy does now!!! Wow! Great food...great specials and our server Stephanie was prompt...witty...and provided great service! Will you see me again....uh yes!!!!! Flo's does happy hour right. Only problem....I ordered so many apps I didn't try the entree's! Next time I will pace myself...as if! Lol....a must try!

aNn2XsRZ88b_5-X3-xhlqA.text: Good food!  Good service!   Great choices!  What else could you want.   Flo's GOT it.  Wonderful addition to the great city of Tempe.   Try it.

F1F7hWYnHkWHoZ18N3VdxQ.text: Very delicious food. 40 minute wait though.  Since it's only been open a short time hopefully the fad will fade away and have more reasonable wait times,  We ordered the spicy and crisp chicken.  Could certainly have been more spicy but it was tasty.  Prices are on the high end for Asian food.

eg81rHn8JMgGJxNav7A3tg.text: This place is a must!! Excellent happy hour prices, great portions, and nice place. The chicken lettuce cups(wraps) were $3.50 on happy hour and it was delicious!!  Happy hour is everyday from 3-7 pm.

I-1_fCVQWKTQfpNv2Am8QQ.text: Did carryout and the food was great...glad to see in Tempe!
